products.title: [November 26, 2025] Veterinary Euthanasia Techniques: A Practical Guide 2nd Edition
products.body_html:
Veterinary Euthanasia Techniques, 2nd Edition: Practical and Compassionate Guidance

This book provides practical how-to guidance for compassionately and confidently caring for various species of animals through euthanasia. It is a must-have reference for anyone involved in animal welfare work and veterinary euthanasia, including general practice vets, specialists, students, and veterinary technicians.

Key Features

  • Species-Specific Organization (NEW!): The book has been reorganized by species to make information easier to find. Each species-specific chapter covers restraint, equipment, sedatives, and techniques.
  • Expanded Species Coverage: Offers guidance for euthanasia techniques in dogs, cats, exotic animals, horses, and production animals. This new edition also includes zoo and marine animals.
  • Complete Technique Breakdown: Covers pre-euthanasia sedation and anesthesia (including unconscious and sedation assessment) and detailed euthanasia techniques (inhalant, injectable, and physical). Guidance is provided on:
    • How death is achieved.
    • Positioning and restraint.
    • How to choose an appropriate method.
  • Current Drug and Welfare Updates: Sections discussing drugs and data have been updated throughout, with new discussions on how to handle pentobarbital shortages and crucial animal welfare considerations.
  • Comprehensive Aftercare: Includes information on burial aftercare, covering the burial process, composting, cremation/incineration, alkaline hydrolysis, and rendering.
  • Client and Historical Context: Addresses client considerations concerning companion animals, and reviews the history of the field, current research, and emerging trends.

products.title: [January 21, 2026] Practical Approach to the Small Animal Emergency Patient 1st Edition
products.body_html:
Practical Approach to the Small Animal Emergency Patient

This book is a concise, accessible guide to clinical decision making in veterinary emergency medicine, focused on the thought process in selecting diagnostic and treatment options. It helps veterinarians identify the critical questions needed to determine diagnostic and therapeutic priorities in emergency situations, emphasizing how to think, not just what to do.

Key Features

  • Decision-Focused Approach: The book reviews important decision points for common emergencies, focusing on current research and decision-making tools to help the clinician decide if a certain intervention is appropriate.
  • General Principles: The first section covers essential general principles of emergency medicine, such as triage, sedation, analgesia, and laboratory work selection.
  • Applied Emergency Presentations: The latter part applies these principles to common emergency presentations, including:
    • Fluid therapy: Covering fluid selection, requirements, patients with heart murmurs, and correcting electrolyte abnormalities.
    • Diabetic emergencies: Including diabetic ketoacidosis, hyperglycemic nonketotic syndrome, and hypoglycemia.
    • Trauma treatment: Management for car accidents, penetrating trauma, and dog bite wounds.
    • Gastrointestinal distress: Assessing surgical versus non-surgical causes, the need for imaging, and differences between inpatient and outpatient assessment.
  • Client Communication: Each chapter includes a section on client communication to guide new clinicians in speaking with family members about diagnostic testing, treatment approaches, and prognosis.
  • Target Audience: An essential guide for clinicians, particularly new graduates and emergency doctors, seeking to gain confidence and improve their decision-making in emergency situations.

products.title: [October 14, 2025] Pathology of Laboratory Rodents and Rabbits 5th Edition
products.body_html:
Pathology of Laboratory Rodents and Rabbits, 5th Edition

This book is a comprehensive reference to pathology in small laboratory mammals, offering a thorough update on diseases in mice, rats, hamsters, gerbils, guinea pigs, chinchillas, and rabbits. It emphasizes explanations of pathogenesis and diagnostically relevant features of diseases.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Species Coverage: The book is logically organized by species, covering laboratory animals and expanded to include diseases and disorders of feral, wild, companion, and livestock counterparts, including zoonotic diseases.
  • New and Updated Content: This edition includes a new chapter on chinchillas and new information on immunodeficient and humanized mice. All content has been updated to reflect changes in the field.
  • In-Depth Pathology Topics: For each species, the book discusses:
    • Anatomic and physiologic features
    • DNA and RNA viral infections
    • Bacterial, fungal, and parasitic infections
    • Nutritional, metabolic, and toxic disorders
    • Non-neoplastic organ system disorders
    • Neoplasms

  • Richly Illustrated Reference: The text is richly illustrated with 690 color photographs and photomicrographs to clearly show the features of common or classic diseases.

  • Target Audience: This is an essential reference for laboratory animal veterinarians, veterinary anatomic pathologists, and clinicians seeing small exotic mammals.

products.title: [January 7, 2025] McCurnin's Clinical Textbook for Veterinary Technicians and Nurses E-Book 11th Edition
products.body_html:
McCurnin's Clinical Textbook for Veterinary Technicians and Nurses, 11th Edition 

This book is the essential resource to prepare you for all the duties of a veterinary technician! McCurnin's Clinical Textbook covers every aspect of veterinary technology, including the care of small and large animals, birds, reptiles, and small mammals. As the cornerstone text in vet tech education, this illustrated guide prepares you for success on the VTNE® and in clinical practice.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Curriculum Coverage: Completely reviewed and updated material throughout covers all areas of the veterinary technology curriculum, ensuring you are current with the latest standards.
  • Step-by-Step Procedures: Procedure boxes offer step-by-step guidelines to performing key tasks , while Technician Note boxes call attention to information relating to the specific role and responsibilities of the technician.
  • Enhanced Critical Thinking: The use of the veterinary technician practice model helps improve your critical thinking and decision-making skills, further reinforced by case presentations that provide real-life scenarios.
  • Broad Species Coverage: Includes dedicated content on:
    • Large animal care, addressing medical records, dentistry, physical examination, surgical assistance, emergency care, and euthanasia.
    • A dedicated chapter on birds, reptiles, and small mammals, presenting up-to-date content on care and treatment for these increasingly popular pets.
  • Essential Clinical Topics: Features comprehensive chapters on pharmacology, pain management, restraint, and veterinary oncology, offering a broader understanding of technician responsibilities.
  • Visual Reinforcement (NEW!): Updated and additional images visually reinforce comprehension and show you step-by-step how to perform procedures. Put Into Practice notes (NEW!) highlight essential information for effective clinical practice.

products.title: [October 3, 2025] Jubb, Kennedy, and Palmer's Pathology of Domestic Animals: Set 7th Edition
products.body_html:
Jubb, Kennedy & Palmer's Pathology of Domestic Animals, 7th Edition (Three Volume Set) 

Known as the pathologist's bible for nearly 60 years, this Three Volume Set continues its tradition as the most comprehensive reference book on common domestic mammal pathology. Using a robust body-systems approach, this essential resource provides expert overviews of system characteristics, reactions to insult, and disease conditions to enrich your understanding of pathogenesis and diagnostic techniques.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Species Coverage: Provides exhaustive coverage of pathology for common domestic mammals, focusing on dogs, cats, horses, swine, cattle, camelids, and small ruminants.
  • Body-Systems Approach: Utilizes a consistent body-systems approach that breaks down disease conditions by the type of infectious or toxic insult affecting the anatomic subdivisions of each body system.
  • Updated Pathological Insights (NEW!): Updated content throughout emphasizes differential diagnoses, insights into pathogenesis, and diagnostic techniques to reflect the latest advances in the field.
  • Extensive Visual Reference: Features more than 2,000 high-quality color images, including new high-resolution images, that clearly depict the diagnostic features of hundreds of conditions, demonstrating normal and abnormal organs, tissues, and cells.
  • Expert Contributors: More than 30 expert contributors offer the latest perspectives on the continuum of issues in veterinary pathology.
  • Enhanced Learning Tools: Current bibliographies offer new entry points into the rapidly expanding literature on each subject.
  • Digital Access (NEW!): An enhanced ebook version is included with every new print purchase, providing digital access to all the text, figures, and references, with customization and search capabilities.

products.title: [September 26, 2025] Canine and Feline Skin Cytology 2nd Edition,
products.body_html:
Canine and Feline Skin Cytology, 2nd Edition: The Comprehensive Diagnostic Tool 

The second edition of Canine and Feline Skin Cytology is the most comprehensive work on the subject, serving as an essential diagnostic tool for veterinary students, practitioners, and pathologists. This revised book offers a 360° view of both inflammatory and neoplastic skin diseases through detailed text and extremely rich iconography.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Iconography: Features more than 1500 clinical, histopathological, and cytological images, making it an indispensable resource for accurate interpretation.
  • Expanded Content (NEW!): The new edition contains 9 chapters (4 more than the first edition), enriching the content with new topics such as "backgrounds" and "cell cytoarchitectures." Crucially, it includes numerous skin tumors not present in the first edition.
  • Fundamental Techniques: The first part provides detailed descriptions of cell morphology, as well as the essential methods of sampling, preparation, and staining of slides to ensure good quality, representative preparations.
  • Disease Focus: The "special" chapters, which are the most important part of the book, detail the cytological pictures of inflammatory and neoplastic diseases, enriched with numerous new skin diseases for greater completeness.
  • Metastasis Coverage: The final chapter is dedicated to the cytological aspects observed in the course of skin metastases originating from internal organs or the mammary gland.
  • Dual Audience: It is a vital resource for veterinary students and veterinarians for lesion interpretation, and the inclusion of histological images makes it a very useful tool for pathologists.

products.title: [December 10, 2025] Battaglia & Steele's Small Animal Emergency and Critical Care for Veterinary Technicians 5th Edition
products.body_html:
Small Animal Emergency and Critical Care for Veterinary Technicians, 5th Edition 

This book is an essential resource for mastering the veterinary technician’s role in caring for critically ill or injured pets. It provides quick access to dozens of common, lifesaving protocols and procedures, setting you up for success on the VTNE, in veterinary practices, and in animal hospital emergency departments.

Key Features

  • Advanced Critical Care Topics (NEW!): Includes two additional chapters providing the latest information on vital areas: High-Flow Nasal Oxygen and Renal Replacement Therapy.
  • Step-by-Step Practical Guidance: Features step-by-step instructions that demonstrate how to perform specific procedures and techniques, guiding you through key assessment and treatment.
  • VTNE Preparation: Includes Medical Math exercises and questions based on real-world scenarios to prepare you for the Veterinary Technician National Examination (VTNE).
  • Comprehensive Clinical Coverage: Provides cutting-edge treatment options for a wide variety of commonly seen presenting problems, with comprehensive coverage of pain management, respiratory emergencies, and urologic emergencies.
  • Visual and Team Focus: Technician Notes highlight specific procedures with diagrams, photos, and detailed instructions, providing at-a-glance guidance. The text emphasizes a team approach to critical care.
  • Updated Equipment: Covers equipment and techniques, including the latest advances in basic lab equipment, fluid therapy, and oxygen therapy.

products.title: [13 Nov. 2025] Animal Biology and Care 4th ed
products.body_html:
Animal Biology and Care, 4th Edition: The Essential Companion 

This book is the essential companion for animal care and animal management students, serving as a foundational text for Level 2 and 3 qualifications. The Fourth Edition introduces the biology and care of species that students learning to work with animals will commonly encounter, with content written in line with current course curricula.

Key Features

  • Logical Structure: Divided into logical sections covering biology, health, and husbandry.
  • Comprehensive Biological Topics: Includes information on cells and basic tissues, movement of materials in the body, body systems and functions , body areas, and basic genetics.
  • Practical Skills Guidance: Provides step-by-step guidance for the common practical procedures carried out in various roles, such as:
    • First aid and basic bandaging.
    • Quarantine and isolation, hospitalization.
    • Monitoring temperature, pulse, respiration.
    • Administration of pharmaceutical drugs.
  • Health and Disease Management: Covers animal welfare, disease transmission and control, microbiology, zoonotic diseases, canine and feline diseases, zoonotic diseases, and parasitology.
  • Animal Husbandry: Addresses animal husbandry, hygiene, nutrition, handling, grooming, and coat care.
  • Career Focus (NEW): Includes a new chapter on the animal industry, featuring information on employability skills and potential vocational pathways to aid career development.
  • Learning Tools: All sections are complemented by visual diagrams, flowcharts, and new chapter glossaries to aid comprehension. Chapter summaries enable readers to remember key points and objectives.
  • Digital Resources: A companion website features interactive MCQs to help learners test their knowledge.
  • Current Updates: Includes updates based on the increase in exotic pets, changes to animal welfare related guidance and legislation, and the introduction of Technical (T-Level) Qualifications.

products.title: [Oct 7, 2025] Advances in Small Animal Care, 2025: Advances in Small Animal Care, 2025, E-Book
products.body_html:
Advances in Small Animal Care: Year in Review for Improved Outcomes

This book, Advances in Small Animal Care, reviews the year's most important findings and updates within the field to provide practitioners with the current clinical information they need to improve patient outcomes. A distinguished editorial board identifies key areas of major progress and controversy, offering insightful overviews that inform and enhance clinical practice.

Key Features

  • Current Clinical Updates: The text synthesizes and distills the latest research and practice guidelines to create timely topic-based reviews, bringing concepts to a clinical level and exploring their everyday impact on patient care.
  • Broad Scope of Topics: Contains 15 articles covering a diverse range of critical areas:
    • Rehabilitation: Including aquatic therapy and pediatric orthopedics and rehabilitation.
    • Emergency and Critical Care: Focusing on the use of point-of-care ultrasound in the ER and ICU.
    • Veterinarian Wellness: Addressing issues like perfectionism and moral stress in veterinary practice.
    • Access to Care: Exploring the spectrum of care and how access relates to animal welfare.
  • Actionable Insights: Provides in-depth, clinical reviews in small animal care, offering actionable insights for direct use in clinical practice.
  • Expert Authorship: Articles are contributed by preeminent specialists invited by an experienced editorial board, ensuring high-quality, authoritative content.

products.title: Posture and Performance: Principles of Training Horses from the Anatomical Perspective
products.body_html: From an equine therapist and rider comes a training manual, based on the Horses Inside Out philosophy: 'Understanding Anatomy Improves Performance and Reduces the Risk of Injury'. Divided into three main parts: Principles of Anatomical Riding and Training; Exercises for Horse and Rider; Troubleshooting, the book contains a wealth of practical tips and exercises broken down into easy to follow, well-illustrated steps showing how riders can improve their riding skills and potential. The author suggests ways to improve horses' physique, posture, flexibility, stability, core strength, performance and movement and how to reduce muscular and movement problems, and reduce the risk of injury. This beautifully illustrated book looks at how to deliver a safe, varied, fun, effective and achievable training program. It provides all the ingredients for riders to make informed decisions to maximise their own and their horse's potential, gain more enjoyment, satisfaction and improve their skills.

products.title: Vaccines in Small Animals. Boosting the Immune Response
products.body_html:
**Selected for Doody's Core Titles® 2024 with "Essential Purchase" designation in Veterinary Medicine**Now Ettinger's trusted, all-in-one veterinary resource is even better! Trusted by small animal veterinarians for more than 50 years, Ettinger's Textbook of Veterinary Internal Medicine adds new content on the field's leading issues and trends to its unmatched, "gold standard" coverage of the diagnosis and treatment of medical problems of dogs and cats. Coverage begins with the basics of veterinary medicine, followed by sections on differential diagnosis for chief complaints and for clinicopathologic abnormalities, and continues with techniques, minimally invasive interventional therapies, critical care, toxicology, diseases by body system, and comorbidities. Clinical information is presented in a way that reflects the practitioner's thought process. With each purchase of this two-volume print book, Ettinger's includes access to a fully searchable eBook featuring more than 750 videos that bring procedures to life. - UNIQUE! 50th anniversary edition of this classic textbook. - NEW! Coverage of the latest information and trends includes epilepsy, aerodigestive disorders, patient triage and stabilization, enteric protozoal diseases, pulmonary thromboembolism, point-of-care ultrasounds, immunodeficiencies, and more. - More than 750 original clinical videos are included with purchase of the print book, providing content you can believe in. Forget those time-consuming searches on YouTube, as each video expertly breaks down veterinary procedures and important signs of diseases and disorders that are difficult or impossible to understand from written descriptions alone. - NEW! PDFs in Techniques chapters include a printable pull list of the equipment and materials needed for specific techniques, along with check boxes (accessed through eBook included with print purchase). - eBook version is included with purchase of the print book, allowing you to access all the text, figures, and references, with the ability to search, customize content, make notes and highlights, and have content read aloud. The eBook also offers the complete collection of original video clips, heart sounds, client information sheets, and hyperlinking of references to their source abstracts in PubMed®. - NEW! Additional new material is included on nutritional cardiomyopathy, coronavirus infections, host-microbial interactions in gastrointestinal health, and autonomic nervous system disorders. - More than 200 clinical algorithms aid in disease identification and decision-making. - Fully searchable online text offers quick access to the most important, newest, and relevant veterinary information. - More than 250 client information sheets are available in the eBook (included with print purchase) with short, easy-to-understand clinical descriptions of conditions, diagnostics, and treatment options

these pages may be downloaded, customized, and printed as client handouts. - Thousands of references for the printed book are accessible online. - Expert contributors from around the world provide practical insight into the latest advances and issues affecting small animal medicine.

products.title: Introduction to Diseases, Diagnosis, and Management of Dogs and Cats
products.body_html:
Introduction to Diseases, Diagnosis, and Management of Dogs and Cats offers an informative and practical resource for an in-depth understanding of the full range of clinical and infectious diseases that occur in dogs and cats. It provides systematic coverage on the pathogenesis of disease, disease manifestation, diagnosis, treatment, therapeutic management, and prevention.

Organized into three main sections, the book begins with an overall introduction and general discussion on the diagnosis and management of clinical and infectious diseases. This section examines the biological systems of dogs and cats, covers clinical examinations and diagnosis methods, specimen collection, nutritional strategies, and health maintenance. Section 2 goes on to discuss a range of clinical diseases that can affect the health of dogs and cats which includes diseases that impact major systems in the body like the cardiovascular, respiratory, gastrointestinal, reproductive, endocrine, nervous, and urinary systems to name a few. It also delves into autoimmune conditions, behavioral orders, and common toxicological phenomenon that occur in dogs and cats and offers strategies for pain management and therapeutic drug intervention. Section 3 rounds out the book with coverage of bacterial, fungal, viral, and parasitic infectious diseases. It explains the pathogenesis of disease, evaluation of the disease, identification of the pathogens and their severity to animals, disease manifestation in the animal, and preventive and treatment strategies to counteract the etiopathogenesis caused by several types of pathogens.

With contributions from experts in the field, Introduction to Diseases, Diagnosis, and Management of Dogs and Cats features the latest advanced veterinary research for researchers, clinicians, and students engaged in researching and treating diseases in dogs and cats.
  • Discusses clinical diseases of dogs and cats including those that impact major systems in the body, specimen collection, clinical examination, diagnosis, and medical interventions
  • Covers the etiology and epidemiology, physical examination abnormalities, pathogenesis, clinical signs, diagnosis, treatment and prognosis, immunity and vaccination, and prevention of infectious diseases
  • Explores advances in diagnosis and treatment including molecular diagnostic techniques and therapies

products.title: Pancreatitis in Dogs Healing Simplified
products.body_html:
Pancreatitis in Dogs Healing Simplified: Your Guide to Healing and Wellness

This book is your trusted guide to understanding the challenging condition of pancreatitis in dogs, providing practical knowledge, evidence-based strategies, and compassionate care tips for managing the disease. Designed to empower dog owners, this comprehensive book covers everything from decoding symptoms to crafting the perfect diet, supporting your dog's health and well-being.

Key Features

  • Clear Explanations: Provides clear explanations of what canine pancreatitis is and how it affects your dog, including symptoms every dog owner should watch for and expert insights into the leading causes of pancreas inflammation.
  • Treatment and Diet: Offers proven treatment options, from medications to holistic approaches. Learn how to build a balanced and effective diet to support your dog’s recovery, and discover low-fat treat options your dog will love.
  • Prevention and Management: Includes essential tips for preventing future episodes of pancreatitis, strategies to manage chronic pancreatitis for long-term health, and guidance on recognizing the signs of an emergency.
  • Holistic Factors: Discusses the role of stress and obesity in triggering pancreatitis and how to mitigate these factors. It also includes information on natural supplements and remedies that may support pancreatic health.
  • Home Monitoring: Provides step-by-step instructions for monitoring your dog’s health at home, including a detailed checklist to track their progress.
  • Owner Empowerment: Offers insightful advice on communicating effectively with your veterinarian and debunks common myths about pancreatitis.
  • Exclusive Focus: Unlike generic pet health books, this book focuses exclusively on this complex condition, offering a deep dive into the causes, treatments, and preventative measures.

products.title: Hundegestütztes Coaching und Training: Effizient, wirkungsvoll und nachhaltig
products.body_html:
Hundegestütztes Coaching und Training: Ein Praxisleitfaden

Dieses Buch erklärt, warum Hunde als lebende, denkende und fühlende Lebewesen so wunderbare Co-Trainer sind und welche verschiedenen Rollen und Funktionen sie dabei einnehmen können. Neben den Grundlagen und Wirkungsweisen von hundegestütztem Coaching und Training, zeigt die Autorin vor allem die Einsatzmöglichkeiten sowie Praxisbeispiele und konkrete Interventionen zur praktischen Anwendung auf.

Wichtige Merkmale

  • Tierzentrierter Ansatz: Ein besonderes Augenmerk liegt auf einem tierzentrierten Ansatz, welcher dem Wohlbefinden des Hundes Rechnung trägt. Wichtige Aspekte der Qualitätssicherung, Auswahlkriterien beim Hund und tierschutzrelevante Gesichtspunkte werden beleuchtet.
  • Vielseitige Einsatzmöglichkeiten: Die tiergestützten Übungen sind unterteilt nach Persönlichkeitsentwicklung, Führungskräfteentwicklung und Teamentwicklung .
  • Fundierter Leitfaden für Profis: Das Buch eröffnet Coaches, Trainern und Hundeerziehern ein spannendes zusätzliches Geschäftsfeld und zeigt deren Wirksamkeit, Grenzen sowie Einsatzmöglichkeiten auf.
  • Stärkung von Kompetenzen: Führungskräfte erfahren, welche Kompetenzen sie durch hundegestütztes Coaching und Training effizienter, wirksamer und nachhaltiger bei sich selbst oder in ihrem Team stärken können.
  • Nutzen für Hundehalter: Hundehalter erhalten Anregungen für die eigene Persönlichkeitsentwicklung mit ihrem Hund und können von einer verbesserten Mensch-Hund-Beziehung profitieren.

products.title: Small Animal Cardiology: The Practical Veterinarian
products.body_html: A comprehensive review of cardiology for the small animal practitioner! Articles will focus on advanced techniques in echocardiography, use of natiuretic peptides in the management of canine patients with heart disease, use of natiuretic peptides in the management of feline patients with heart disease, current use of pimobendan in canine patients with heart disease, canine mitral valve disease, infective endocarditis, interventional catheterization for congenital heart disease, pulmonary hypertension, feline hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, feline arrhythmias, surgery for cardiac disease, gene therapy for cardiac disease, and much more!

products.title: Tschauner’s Guide to Small Animals Clinics 3rd Edition
products.body_html: With 800 pages, perfect bound, this booklet is a quick reference guide for common problems encountered in small animal clinics. These problems are outlined in table form for quick reference. This is a must for students in their senior year during small animal clinics.

products.title: Eat, Play, Love (Your Dog): The Ultimate Guide for Every Dog Owner
products.body_html:
Eat, Play, Love (Your Dog): Your Go-To Guide for a Happy, Healthy Life

This book is the essential go-to guide every dog owner needs to provide their dog with the healthiest and happiest life possible. Written by Lara Shannon, a certified dog trainer and pet food nutritionist, the book covers everything you need to know about caring for your dog from puppyhood until the end of life.

Key Features

  • Three Handy Sections: The book is logically divided into three handy chapters—Eat, Play, and Love—tackling all the important subjects of canine care.
  • Nutrition to Thrive: Provides necessary advice on ensuring your dog gets the right diet it needs to thrive.
  • Behavior Solutions: The book includes guidance on how to successfully address common dog behavior issues.
  • Practical Activities: You'll find healthy D.I.Y dog food and treat recipes, brain games and activities to engage your dog, and advice for choosing the right dog for your lifestyle.
  • Anxiety and Well-being: Offers guidance on overcoming common anxieties and helps you understand why dogs do what they do, providing advice to meet their mental and physical needs.
  • Expert Authorship: The author draws upon many years of experience working as a certified dog trainer and pet food nutritionist.

products.title: BSAVA Manual of Canine and Feline Rehabilitation, Supportive and Palliative Care: Case Studies in Patient Management 1st Edition
products.body_html:
Your Essential Guide to Veterinary Rehabilitation and Supportive Care 

This NEW Manual is aimed at the whole veterinary team, focusing on how to help companion animals achieve the fullest function and quality of life possible after surgery, trauma, or disease. It is a truly innovative resource that blends scientific principles with practical application to manage chronic conditions effectively.

Key Features

  • Principles of Care: Part One thoroughly discusses the principles of rehabilitation, supportive, and palliative care. It explores the science behind pain and its management, clinical nutrition, and physical therapies, reviewing clinical applications with reference to published evidence.
  • Innovative Case Studies: Part Two presents a collection of Case Studies across a range of canine and feline patients—from discospondylitis to glaucoma in dogs and from triaditis to leg amputation in cats.
  • Multidisciplinary Management: Every case study includes an expert assessment of:
    • Acute and chronic pain management
    • Fear, stress, and conflict concerns
    • Nutritional requirements
    • Physiotherapy and Hydrotherapy
    • Acupuncture
    • Nursing and supportive care
    • Owner advice and homecare recommendations
  • Holistic Patient Focus: The book supports the entire practice team in managing the complex needs of patients who are surviving what would once have been rapidly fatal conditions.

products.title: [June 5, 2025] Hot Topics in Emergency and Critical Care, An Issue of Veterinary Clinics of North America: Small Animal Practice
products.body_html:
Hot Topics in Small Animal Medicine: Clinical Updates

This book is an eclectic compilation of some of the most popular topics in small animal medicine, offering updates on the latest advances and developments for practitioners. Top experts provide in-depth clinical reviews on hot topics, synthesizing and distilling the latest research and practice guidelines to create clinically significant content.

Key Features

  • Practice-Oriented Topics: Contains a variety of highly relevant, practice-oriented topics, including urinary tract infection treatment and comparative therapeutics.
  • Emergency and Critical Care: Focuses on essential critical care subjects such as acute kidney injury in dogs and cats, fluid and electrolyte therapy during vomiting and diarrhea, and the basics of mechanical ventilation.
  • Fluid Therapy Detailed: Provides specific information on fluid therapy for the emergent small animal patient, covering crystalloids, colloids, and albumin products.
  • Actionable Insights: The book provides in-depth clinical reviews that offer actionable insights for immediate use in clinical practice.
  • Expert Synthesis: Authors, under the leadership of experienced editors, synthesize and distill the latest research and practice guidelines to ensure the information is current and authoritative.

products.title: Clinical Atlas of Small Animal Cytology and Hematology, 2nd Edition
products.body_html:
Hematology Techniques and Concepts for Veterinary Technicians, 2nd Edition 

Now in full color, this book is a thorough update to the introduction to the fundamental concepts of collecting, handling, and preparing hematology samples. Designed specifically for veterinary technicians and students, this book ensures you gain a full understanding of why each test is performed and how to ensure accurate test results.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Fundamentals: Covers the basics of blood composition, cell morphology, and sample collection, handling, and preparation.
  • New Automated Testing Chapter: A new chapter covers automated testing, addressing recent advances in technology, equipment, and test techniques.
  • User-Friendly Learning Aids: Key concepts have been added to each chapter to better promote learning, and terms are now defined throughout the text, with definitions collected into a glossary.
  • Visual and Practical Reference: The book is user-friendly and well-illustrated with charts, reference values, algorithms, and photomicrographs, making it a key reference for veterinary technicians and students.
  • Online Resources: A companion website provides review questions and images from the book for download, enhancing learning and practical application.
  • Accuracy Focus: It is specifically designed to help veterinary technicians and students gain a full understanding of the test rationale and ensure accurate test results.

products.title: [January 9, 2026] Battaglia & Steele's Small Animal Emergency and Critical Care for Veterinary Technicians 5th Edition
products.body_html:
Small Animal Emergency and Critical Care for Veterinary Technicians, 5th Edition 

This book is an essential resource for mastering the veterinary technician’s role in caring for critically ill or injured pets. It provides quick access to dozens of common, lifesaving protocols and procedures, setting you up for success on the VTNE, in veterinary practices, and in animal hospital emergency departments.

Key Features

  • Step-by-Step Protocols: Step-by-step instructions demonstrate how to perform specific procedures and techniques , guiding you through key assessment and treatment techniques.
  • New and Updated Content: The fifth edition includes two additional chapters: High-Flow Nasal Oxygen and Renal Replacement Therapy, providing the latest information on these vital areas in emergency and critical care. All content is updated and expanded.
  • Comprehensive Clinical Coverage: It provides cutting-edge treatment options for a wide variety of commonly seen presenting problems, with comprehensive coverage of pain management, respiratory emergencies, and urologic emergencies.
  • Equipment and Techniques: Covers equipment and techniques, including the latest advances in basic lab equipment, fluid therapy, and oxygen therapy.
  • VTNE Preparation: Includes Medical Math exercises and questions based on real-world scenarios to prepare you for the Veterinary Technician National Examination (VTNE).
  • Visual Guidance: Technician Notes highlight specific procedures with diagrams, photos, and detailed instructions, providing you with at-a-glance guidance.
  • Team Approach: The text emphasizes a team approach to critical care, preparing you for the collaborative veterinary setting.

products.title: [February 5, 2025] Ways to be a Better Veterinarian: Tips and stories for new, old, or prospective animal doctors
products.body_html:
Ways to be a Better Veterinarian: Your Guide to Professional Fulfillment

This book offers a comprehensive guide packed with practical tips and insights to help veterinarians, from individuals looking to apply to veterinary school to seasoned professionals, elevate their practice and enrich their careers. It delves into the nuances of becoming not just a better doctor, but a more empathetic and effective caregiver.

Key Features

  • Elevated Practice: The guide is packed with practical tips and insights to help you elevate your practice and enrich your careers, starting from veterinary school applications to seasoned practice.
  • Emotional Resilience: It covers managing the emotional challenges of the job and essential self-care techniques for maintaining emotional resilience and a work-life balance.
  • Team and Client Focus: Readers will discover ways to cultivate a culture of teamwork and collaboration within a veterinary practice and learn how to build stronger relationships with pet owners.
  • Practical Insights: It includes a fun and concise list of recommendations and personal stories from the author, providing a taste of veterinary medicine.
  • Ultimate Companion: This easy-to-read format is your ultimate companion on the journey to becoming a more skilled, thoughtful, and fulfilled veterinarian.

products.title: Veterinary Technician and Nurse's Daily Reference Guide: Canine and Feline 4th Edition
products.body_html:
Veterinary Technician and Nurse's Daily Reference Guide, 4th Edition 

This book is the revised and expanded new edition of this classic reference to daily skills used by veterinary technicians. It provides rapid access to essential information in clinical practice, covering diagnostic and patient care skills, diseases, preventive care, anatomy, and anesthesia in an easy-to-use tabular format.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Coverage: The book covers diagnostic and patient care skills, diseases and conditions, preventive care, anatomy, and anesthesia, addressing all major areas of veterinary technician education and training.
  • New Chapters and Content: Brand-new chapters describe licensure and certifications in veterinary technology and discuss nursing theory and science and its relation to veterinary nursing.
  • Updated Clinical Practices: Expanded and updated coverage includes novel therapeutics in dermatology, vaccination standards, pain assessment and management, stress-free handling and nursing care strategies, RECOVER CPR guidelines, and advancements in diagnostic capabilities.
  • Quick-Reference Format: Written by experienced veterinary specialists, the book integrates charts, tables, and concise explanatory text to enable quick and efficient retrieval of information in the clinic.
  • Visual Learning: It contains hundreds of clear illustrations and high-quality photographs.
  • Digital Resources: Features a companion website with forms and worksheets, self-review questions, vocabulary flashcards, links to online resources, and PowerPoint slides.
  • Broad Audience: Remains an invaluable resource for both student and practicing veterinary technicians and nurses of all skill and experience levels.

products.title: Veterinary Parasitology 5th Edition
products.body_html:
Veterinary Parasitology, 5th Edition: Your Definitive Reference 

This book is the definitive, comprehensive reference for veterinary parasitology, providing essential information for identification, diagnosis, and treatment. The fifth edition has undergone significant updates to reflect recent advances in research and medical practice, making this restructured guide more accessible and user-friendly.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Coverage: The book covers all major aspects of veterinary parasitology, including biology, diagnostic techniques, drugs, and effective vaccines. This field is vital for protecting animal health and welfare, ensuring food safety, and safeguarding public health.
  • Structured Organization: For ease of reference, the new edition is divided by parasite taxonomy and host species, including dogs and cats, equids, cattle, sheep, ungulates, birds, exotics, and laboratory animals.
  • Advanced Diagnostics: It includes video-based practical guides to the diagnosis in veterinary parasitology and features new figures and images to facilitate the reader experience.
  • Updated Science: Content includes detailed new information on the biological life cycles of parasites, modification of taxonomic names based on molecular advances, and coverage of new approaches to control and distribution of parasites.
  • Broad Audience: It is the ideal reference for students and practitioners seeking an easy-to-use listing of all parasites of importance in veterinary practice, and also appeals to specialists and researchers.

products.title: Veterinary Medicine: A textbook of the diseases of cattle, horses, sheep, pigs and goats 11th Edition
products.body_html:
Veterinary Medicine, 11th Edition: Your Definitive Large Animal Reference 

This book is the definitive, one-stop reference for farm animal and equine care, providing up-to-date information on the diseases of horses, cattle, sheep, goats, and pigs. This comprehensive guide covers the entire scope of clinical practice for large animals.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Species Coverage: It covers the diseases of all major large animal species: horses, cattle, sheep, goats, and pigs.
  • Logical Structure: This edition has been divided into two volumes and restructured into a logical, anatomically based approach to disease, making the vast amount of information easy to navigate.
  • Clinical Practice Essentials: Comprehensive coverage includes the principles of clinical examination and making a diagnosis, along with specific therapy recommendations.
  • Expert Authorship: Written by internationally known veterinary experts, ensuring the content is authoritative, reliable, and reflects the latest in veterinary medicine.
  • Definitive Resource: This book is the definitive, one-stop reference for all aspects of farm animal and equine care.

products.title: Veterinary Medical Education: A Practical Guide 2nd Edition
products.body_html:
Veterinary Medical Education, 2nd Edition: Your Practical Guide

This book is a comprehensive reference to all aspects of veterinary medical education, providing concrete, real-world, and veterinary-specific advice for instructors in a variety of settings. This revised edition has been significantly enhanced and updated, featuring twelve new chapters and many expanded chapters, making it an indispensable resource for anyone involved with veterinary education.

Key Features

  • Curriculum Design and Innovation: The book offers practical guidance on all aspects of designing and implementing a veterinary curriculum, with new and expanded information on competency-based veterinary education and curricular innovations.
  • Expanded Topics: It includes new and expanded information on widening access on admissions, academic advising and student support, eLearning, transition to practice, career opportunities, educational leadership, and global veterinary education.
  • Teaching and Learning: The book covers learning theories, their application in the classroom, and effective teaching in clinical and non-clinical settings, including creating safe, inclusive learning environments.
  • Assessment and Professionalism: It details programmatic and technology-enhanced assessment, academic advising, coaching, and mentoring. It also addresses professionalism, professional identity, and cultural humility.
  • Practical Tools: It includes diagrams, figures, and informational boxes that highlight key points, clarify concepts, and provide helpful tips and evidence from the literature for educational innovations.
  • Broad Audience: An indispensable resource for instructors and faculty at veterinary colleges, continuing education instructors, veterinary technology instructors, and veterinarians training in internships and residencies.

products.title: Veterinary Instruments and Equipment: A Pocket Guide 5th Edition
products.body_html:
Veterinary Instruments and Equipment, 5th Edition: Your Pocket Reference 

This book is a vital resource designed to help you quickly identify veterinary instruments and equipment at a glance. Written by a vet tech educator, this pocket guide uses a flashcard-style format with hundreds of detailed, full-color photographs, making it easy to review for exams and serving as an invaluable quick reference in real-world veterinary practice.

Key Features

  • Flashcard Format: The unique two-page flashcard format is perfect for learning and quizzing for each instrument. The top page contains a photo of the instrument, and the bottom page contains the instrument’s name, function, and characteristics.
  • Extensive Visuals: With more than 650 high-quality color photos of instruments, you can quickly recognize and identify the equipment.
  • New Organization: The chapters are newly organized by small animal and large animal sections, and alphabetized within those sections, making content easier than ever to find for simplified studying.
  • Comprehensive Coverage:
    • General Medical Instruments: Includes equipment for common procedures such as dehorning, hoof care, and castration, plus instruments for diagnostic and obstetrical procedures.
    • Surgical Instruments: Covers general instruments (hemostats, forceps, scissors) and specialty instruments (orthopedic, ophthalmic, and dental).
    • Restraint Equipment: Provides coverage of restraint equipment and proper restraint techniques for all species of small and large animals.
  • Digital Resource: Instrument photos on a companion website allow you to rotate instruments 360 degrees and zoom in to see close-ups of the different tips.
  • Portability: The pocket size and spiral binding make this guide perfect for portability and point-of-need reference.

products.title: Ultrasonography of the Bovine Musculoskeletal System: Indications, Examination Protocols, Findings
products.body_html:
Your Practical Guide to Bovine Musculoskeletal Ultrasonography

This book provides specific instructions for the ultrasonographic examination of the bovine musculoskeletal system, which is now a routine examination in veterinary clinics worldwide. It is a must-have for modern cattle practitioners who want to broaden their diagnostic horizon.

Key Features

  • Practical Instructions: The book provides specific instructions for the ultrasonographic examination of individual joints and describes particular anatomical landmarks of each region as a guide.
  • Extensive Visuals: In over 300 illustrations, international specialists present normal sonoanatomical findings and sonopathological findings of common diseases.
  • Dual Application: Practical veterinarians can use their existing ultrasound equipment not only for gynaecological but increasingly also for orthopaedic examinations of calves and adult cattle.
  • Expert Authorship: The information and images are presented by international specialists, ensuring a high level of expertise.
  • Diagnostic Expansion: The book is designed to help modern cattle practitioners broaden their diagnostic horizon.

products.title: Toxicologic Pathology: A Primer 1st Edition
products.body_html:
Toxicologic Pathology: A Primer - Your Essential Guide to Nonclinical Safety

This book is a practical, easy-to-use reference designed to be the first basic overview covering the field of toxicologic pathology. It contains the core, underlying principles of the discipline, making it valuable to the veterinary pathology student considering a career in the field and serving as a succinct refresher for the seasoned toxicologic pathologist.

Key Features

  • Core Principles and Concepts: The book introduces the basic, underlying principles of toxicologic pathology, including an overview chapter covering the field and a "concept" chapter describing its role in drug development.
  • Systematic Organization: The Primer is arranged as chapters presenting each major organ system. These chapters provide histopathologic descriptions of lesions observed in toxicity studies and testing of chemicals that may negatively impact the environment.
  • Lesion Significance: Each organ system chapter provides additional information related to a particular lesion to aid the reader in better understanding its toxicologic significance relative to human risk.
  • Chapter Structure: Each organ system chapter is consistently structured, containing:
    • A brief introduction.
    • A succinct description of the anatomy and physiology of the system.
    • Descriptions of the most important pathological lesions.
    • Differential diagnoses.
    • Biological consequences, pathogenesis, and/or mechanism of lesion formation.
    • Associated clinical pathology correlates.
  • Broad Audience: This Primer is useful for nonclinical safety scientists (like study directors and senior toxicology report reviewers), scientific management of Contract Research Organizations (CROs), and students.

products.title: The Laboratory Mouse (Laboratory Animal Pocket Reference) 3rd Edition
products.body_html:
The Laboratory Mouse: Your Guide to Biology and Care

This book is the most accessible reference on the biology and care of the mouse in research settings, revised to reflect the latest advances in transgenic and genetic engineering technologies. This guide presents basic information and common procedures in detail, making it an ideal quick reference for investigators, technicians, and animal caretakers.

Key Features

  • Novel Technologies: The new edition adds information on novel technologies such as CRISPR-Cas and covers new concepts like pain assessment by facial expression and the importance of nest-building as an assessment tool of well-being.
  • Expanded Management: It includes information on updated housing systems and management practices.
  • Comprehensive Care: There are expanded sections on anesthesia and analgesia, and on behavior and enrichment, ensuring humane care and successful procedural outcomes.
  • Quick Reference: It provides a quick reference source for investigators, technicians, and animal caretakers charged with the care and/or use of mice in a research setting.
  • Broad Audience: This book is particularly valuable to those new to working with mice who need to start research programs using these animals.

products.title: The Impact of Therapy and Pet Animals on Human Stress
products.body_html:
Animals and Human Stress: A Research Collection

This book showcases a rich collection of research papers from Human-Animal Interactions, highlighting a growing body of evidence that suggests animals, both as pets and therapy partners, can help mitigate people's stress levels.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Research Collection: It features a rich collection of research papers focused on the impact of animals on human stress.
  • Broad Application: The research pertains to pets as well as animal-assisted therapy in both school and professional settings.
  • Holistic View: The book provides comprehensive information on the influence of animals on human stress, addressing both mental, physical, and psychological health.
  • Scene-Setting Structure: Includes a scene-setting introduction and a wrap-up conclusion from the editor, providing context and synthesis for the research presented.
  • Target Audience: A useful resource for anyone interested in human health or human-animal relationships.

products.title: The Handbook of Zoonotic Diseases of Goats
products.body_html:
Zoonotic Diseases of Goats: A One Health Guide 

This book provides clear, accurate, and comprehensive coverage of the zoonotic diseases of goats, taking a One Health approach to address the spread of disease between livestock and their keepers. Given the goat's importance for meat, milk, fiber, and leather production across Asia, Africa, and Europe, this book is an invaluable resource for veterinary practitioners and public health experts around the world.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Disease Coverage: The book reviews bacterial, viral, parasitic, rickettsial, and fungal diseases of goats that have public health implications.
  • In-Depth Information: It includes information on the aetiology, epidemiology and transmission cycle, clinical symptoms, diagnosis, and prevention and control strategies for each disease.
  • Quick Reference: The content is organized to help readers quickly locate information about the disease's severity, mode of spread, treatment, and safety precautions.
  • Public Health Education: It discusses the importance of educating animal owners about the public health implications of zoonotic diseases.
  • One Health Focus: By taking a One Health approach, the book addresses the vital link between animal health, human health, and the environment.
  • Broad Audience: An invaluable resource for veterinary practitioners and public health experts, as well as a useful reference for researchers and students.

products.title: The Feline Patient 5th Edition
products.body_html:
The Feline Patient, 5th Edition: Your Essential Quick Reference

This book is the classic quick reference to feline medicine, offering more than 300 chapters that cover all aspects of feline veterinary practice. Comprehensive yet accessible, this fully updated new edition omits lengthy discussions on pathophysiology in favor of an emphasis on clinically relevant information for diagnosis, treatment, and prognosis.

Key Features

  • Quick-Access Format: The book arranges topics alphabetically within sections, allowing busy clinicians to rapidly find information specific to the unique needs of cats.
  • New and Expanded Content: The Fifth Edition includes 30 additional chapters and new clinical pearls providing observations about diseases and procedures gleaned from over forty-five years of clinical practice.
  • Clinical Focus: It focuses on clinically relevant information for diagnosis, treatment, and prognosis, making its approach carefully designed for use in the clinical setting.
  • Global Expertise: Includes chapters written by a global list of contributors for an international perspective.
  • Enhanced Resources: Offers a new companion website providing hundreds of additional images as well as video clips of clinical cases and procedures.
  • Improved Design: Presents an improved layout and page design for ease of navigation and better presentation of the massive amount of important information.

products.title: The Complete Textbook of Veterinary Nursing 2nd Edition
products.body_html:
The Complete Textbook of Veterinary Nursing, 2nd Edition: Your Standard Resource

This book has established itself as a recommended standard text for all veterinary nurses, designed to satisfy the requirements of the new syllabus and provide a wide range of information for qualified nurses. This new second edition has been updated and revised to align perfectly with the needs of a new generation of students.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Content: The content is comprehensive, endorsed by all leading course providers, and written by veterinary nurses for veterinary nurses.
  • Brand New Chapters: Includes brand new chapters on Ethics and Welfare, Communication, and Physiotherapy.
  • New Nursing Models: Features a new section on Nursing Care Models to provide veterinary nurses with the necessary information to use this concept in their own practices.
  • Updated Practices and Legislation: All chapters are revised and updated in line with changes in legislation, knowledge, and current practical techniques.
  • Dog Behavior Update: The dog behavior chapter is updated and revised to reflect the latest thinking about the process of domestication and its relevance to training methods.
  • Enhanced Learning: Features full color illustrations for maximum clarity and additional online resources to maximize learning potential. The improved website offers a range of film clips of essential procedures and comprehensive test-yourself questions in both study and assessment modes.
  • Digital Access: The entire text is accessible as an e-book with full note-making, referencing, and search functionality.

products.title: Textbook for the Veterinary Assistant, 2nd Edition 2nd Edition
products.body_html:
Textbook for the Veterinary Assistant, 2nd Edition: Your Complete Curriculum Guide

This book is a fully updated and revised edition that delivers a complete exploration of the veterinary assisting curriculum approved by the National Association of Veterinary Technicians in America (NAVTA). This comprehensive text is ideal for students and instructors, reflecting cutting-edge advances in veterinary practice.

Key Features

  • Curriculum Alignment: The book provides a complete exploration of the veterinary assisting curriculum, making it an ideal resource for students studying for the NAVTA Approved Veterinary Assistant exam.
  • New and Updated Content: It includes a new chapter on laboratory considerations and an updated chapter on avian and exotics covering popular exotic pets.
  • Fundamental Knowledge: It provides a thorough introduction to medical terminology, veterinary anatomy (including all relevant systems), and detailed coverage of animal nutrition (including weight management and food assessment).
  • Practical Skills: It features practical discussions of the behavior, handling, and restraint of animals, including explorations of animal body language.
  • Extensive Digital Resources: Readers get access to an expanded companion website that offers teaching PowerPoints, homework assignments, self-assessment tests and quizzes, multiple-choice questions, breed study guides, and instructional video clips.
  • Broad Audience: An ideal resource for veterinary assistant students and practicing veterinary assistants seeking a one-stop, up-to-date resource.

products.title: Swine respiratory disease
products.body_html:
A Practical Overview of Porcine Respiratory Disease Complex (PRDC)

This book aims at providing an updated overview on the most frequent pathogens responsible for Porcine Respiratory Disease Complex (PRDC), including viruses and bacteria that potentiate their anatomical and functional effects. The authors, prestigious and rewarded experts, have focused their efforts on preparing chapters that illustrate the latest information and data on the treated topics.

Key Features

  • Pathogen Focus: The book focuses on the most frequent pathogens responsible for PRDC, detailing how viruses and bacteria act in association to worsen the clinical outcome.
  • Clinical and Economic Impact: It addresses the significant clinical outcome and economic impact of PRDC on swine production.
  • Updated Information: The chapters illustrate the latest information and data on the treated topics, ensuring the reader has access to current research.
  • Practical Approach: The book is designed to facilitate comprehension and educational enrichment to the preparation of a well-designed, practical approach to PRDC management.
  • Expert Authorship: Written by prestigious and rewarded experts with wide experience in respiratory diseases in pigs.

products.title: Practical Color Genetics for Livestock Breeders
products.body_html:
Practical Color Genetics for Livestock Breeders: Your Breeding Strategy Guide

This book is an essential guide for animal breeders on the biology behind coat color in large animals. Since coat color is one of the fundamental elements of breeding, this book directs breeders on how to implement breeding strategies to achieve desired results for showing purposes and for industry use, such as in sheep and alpaca wool.

Key Features

  • Breeding Strategy Implementation: The guide directs breeders on how to implement breeding strategies to achieve desired coat color results.
  • Complex Genetics Explained: It simplifies the complicated biology of coat color, where many dominant and recessive traits interact to produce the base coat color.
  • Genotype vs. Phenotype: The book explains why the phenotype (visual appearance) does not always reflect the underlying genotype and how to manage the interaction of alleles.
  • Industry Relevance: The content is crucial for breeders concerned with showing purposes and fiber industry use (e.g., sheep and alpaca wool).
  • Practical Focus: This book provides a practical, necessary guide to mastering coat color genetics alongside health and conformation goals.

products.title: Practical Canine Behaviour: For Veterinary Nurses and Technicians
products.body_html:
Your Quick Reference to Practical Canine Behaviour

This book is a quick reference and practically relevant canine behaviour resource, drawing on more than 20 years of experience from a practicing veterinary nurse and Certificated Clinical Animal Behaviourist (CCAB). It is designed to meet the specific needs of the veterinary nurse or technician and the wider general practice team.

Key Features

  • New Behavioral Concepts: The new edition has been completely revised and updated to include new sections on canine emotions, the role of play, and how the canine senses affect a dog's perception of their world and communication.
  • Practical Advice & First Aid: It includes updated and expanded behavioural first aid advice and covers factors to consider when assessing risk.
  • Veterinary Practice Focus: A new chapter addresses the practice's role in mitigating fear of visiting the practice and veterinary interventions.
  • Stress and Restraint Management: The book discusses the application of the "trigger stacking" principle to reduce stress and aggression in practice and outlines approaches to minimizing restraint when handling.
  • Breed and Genetics: It includes a discussion of the relevance and limitations of breed in our understanding of dog behaviour.
  • Welfare and Prevention: The focus is on the emotional welfare of dogs, with strategies for managing or addressing unwanted behaviour and tips for running successful puppy socialization classes.

products.title: Physiology of Domestic Animals
products.body_html:
Physiology of Domestic Animals, 3rd Edition: Your Guide to Functional Physiology

This textbook is primarily targeted toward students of veterinary, animal, and agricultural sciences, providing a comprehensive, revised guide to the functional aspects of physiology. This edition has been comprehensively revised to encompass recent progress in domestic animal physiology, making it a globally recommended resource.

Key Features

  • Functional Emphasis: The textbook emphasizes the functional aspects of physiology, helping students grasp how physiological concepts apply in real-world scenarios.
  • Extensive Learning Tools: The book contains more than 600 color illustrations, over 3,000 short, clarifying statements placed in the margin, and approximately 2,000 questions for self-assessment.
  • Clinical Application: It includes nearly 200 clinical examples designed to help students develop the essential problem-solving skills needed in their future careers.
  • Updated Content: The third edition, published in 2016, is comprehensively revised to encompass recent progress in domestic animal physiology.
  • Global Recognition: The book is a currently recommended textbook for students at universities across more than 15 countries, including the US, Canada, Australia, and numerous European nations.

products.title: Physical Therapy and Massage for the Horse: Biomechanics-Excercise-Treatment, Second Edition 2nd Edition
products.body_html:
Equine Biomechanics and Physical Therapy: An Expanded Guide

This book is an expanded and updated edition of a bestselling guide, providing a unique blend of basic biomechanics and practical physical therapeutic techniques for horses. Authored by a world leader in equine anatomy and a horse physiotherapist of international repute, the content focuses on relieving pain and improving performance, particularly in the sporting horse.

Key Features

  • Unique Blend of Expertise: The book provides a unique blend of basic biomechanics and practical physical therapeutic techniques.
  • New Structure and Content: The new edition has been restructured and includes a new chapter on mobilization and stretching.
  • Performance Focus: The core objective is to provide methods to relieve pain and improve performance, especially in the sporting horse.
  • Enhanced Visuals: Includes 61 new illustrations to clarify techniques and anatomical concepts.
  • Broad Audience: This highly original book will be of interest to all those involved in equine welfare, including veterinary practitioners, students, therapists, horse owners, riders, and trainers.

products.title: Pests and Parasites of Horses
products.body_html:
Your Guide to Equine Pest and Parasite Management

This book is the first resource available for equine enthusiasts to learn about pest identification, ecology, and management for horses, mules, and donkeys. It covers the major pests in the United States, Canada, Europe, Australia, and New Zealand, along with the veterinary conditions and recommended care associated with these pests.

Key Features

  • Pest Identification and Management: The book covers the major pests of horses, ranging from flies to ticks and parasitic worms, providing a complete guide to their identification, ecology, and management.
  • Practical Control Methods: It shows practical, science-based control methods for pest management, which readers can use to protect their animals.
  • Integrated Pest Management: It includes a sample integrated pest management plan that readers can personalize for pest control on their own property.
  • Educational Resources: It includes a glossary for reference and a brief introduction to basic entomology.
  • Visual Aid: Detailed photographs help to identify species and perform management tasks effectively.
  • Broad Audience: A useful resource for horse riders, trainers, owners, caretakers, and general equine enthusiasts, as well as students in animal sciences, veterinary sciences, and related programs.
  • Global Scope: The book covers major pests in the United States, Canada, Europe, Australia, and New Zealand.

products.title: Pediatrics, An Issue of Veterinary Clinics of North America
products.body_html:
Veterinary Clinics: Exotic Animal Pediatrics 

This book, part of a leading veterinary series, brings considerable expertise to the topic of Pediatrics in Exotic Animal Practice. It covers the natural history, clinically relevant development milestones, husbandry, common diseases, and recommended preventative care for juvenile exotic animals.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Species Coverage: Contains 15 relevant, practice-oriented topics covering essential exotic pets such as rabbits, rodents, psittacines, reptiles, and hedgehogs, as well as wildlife.
  • Clinical Focus: Each chapter offers in-depth clinical reviews on pediatrics, providing actionable insights for daily practice.
  • Integrated Management: The content covers all aspects of juvenile care, including housing, social grouping, diet, common diseases, anti-parasitics, sterilization, and vaccinations.
  • Behavior and Nutrition: Includes dedicated topics on behavioral development and conditioning of juvenile animals and clinical nutrition of juvenile exotic animals.
  • Expertise and Authority: Presents the latest information under the leadership of experienced editors and authors who synthesize and distill the latest research and practice guidelines.

products.title: Pathology at a Glance 2nd Edition
products.body_html:
Pathology at a Glance, 2nd Edition: Your Essential Revision Guide

This book is an accessible introduction and revision text for medical students, utilizing the familiar and easy-to-use at a Glance format and presented in full-color. Reflecting changes to medical school curricula, this new edition provides a user-friendly overview of pathology, giving students and junior doctors all the information they need in a concise format.

Key Features

  • Accessible Format: The book presents schematic diagrams on the left page and concise explanations on the right, making the subject easy to understand. It is designed for quick reference and revision.
  • Comprehensive Structure: The content is divided into three sections, covering general pathology, systematic pathology, and clinical case examples.
  • Curriculum-Aligned Content: It addresses the key principles of pathology central to medicine, covering general pathology mechanisms and the clinical pathology of body systems.
  • Key Information: Provides key information on the epidemiology, pathogenesis, and clinical features of the major diseases.
  • Chapter Revisions: Includes revisions of many chapters, particularly gynaecological pathology, acute cardiac syndromes, paediatric tumours, and haematopathology.
  • Self-Assessment: Contains self-assessment material, including 10 structured case study questions, ideal for preparing for final exams and membership exams for junior doctors.
  • Broad Audience: An invaluable resource for all medical students (from those starting their study to those approaching finals) and junior doctors approaching their membership exams.

products.title: Parasites of Cattle and Sheep: A Practical Guide to their Biology and Control
products.body_html:
Your In-Depth Guide to Cattle and Sheep Parasitology

This book is the first review devoted solely to parasites of domestic cattle and sheep, providing in-depth, focused advice that can be tailored to individual farms. It is an essential resource for students, veterinarians, and researchers, as it maintains a focus on ruminant parasitology to deliver evidence-based advice and context for the application of basic research.

Key Features

  • Focused Species Coverage: The book focuses exclusively on common parasites of domestic sheep and cattle, making the information highly relevant for ruminant practice.
  • Holistic Impact Assessment: It considers the impact of parasites, both as individual species and as co-infections, integrating epidemiological information, monitoring, and diagnostic procedures.
  • Farm-Specific Control: The text highlights the fundamental importance of the individual farm and farmer in assessing endemic parasitism and tailoring control options accordingly.
  • Evidence-Based Management: It reviews the basis for control measures, such as the responsible use of parasiticides, adaptive animal husbandry, and other management practices.
  • Epidemiology and Host Response: It places emphasis on understanding host responses and epidemiology so that the impact and seasonality of parasitism can be incorporated into advice and decision-making.
  • Visual Aid: The content is supported throughout by diagrams and photos to aid diagnosis, enhancing its utility as a practical guide.
  • Comprehensive Reference: Provides a comprehensive reference listing, including important historical citations, to underpin the content.

products.title: Orthopaedic pathologies of the stifle joint
products.body_html:
Your Practical Guide to Stifle Joint Orthopedics

This book deals with the main orthopedic conditions of the stifle joint in dogs and cats, enabling veterinary surgeons to assess, diagnose, and treat the disorders commonly seen in their practice. It is intended to help veterinary clinicians make a correct diagnosis and prognosis and establish the most appropriate drug or surgical treatment for each case.

Key Features

  • Clinical Focus: The content is focused on helping veterinary surgeons assess, diagnose, and treat the disorders commonly seen in their practice.
  • High-Quality Visuals: The book contains plenty of high-quality images and illustrations as well as links to videos through QR codes, which provide additional information and contribute to making the book even more practical.
  • Treatment Guidance: It is designed to help clinicians establish the most appropriate drug or surgical treatment for each case.
  • Diagnosis and Prognosis: A key goal is to help veterinary clinicians make a correct diagnosis and prognosis for orthopedic pathologies of the stifle joint.
  • Practical Resource: The use of visual aids and practical content makes this a highly usable resource for daily clinical application.

products.title: Nephrology and Urology of Small Animals 1st (first) Edition published by Wiley-Blackwell
products.body_html:
Your Comprehensive Clinical Reference for Small Animal Urology

This book provides veterinarians with the knowledge needed to effectively diagnose and treat urologic diseases in canine, feline, and exotic patients. Serving as an easy-to-use, comprehensive clinical reference, the text takes an evidence-based approach to detailed coverage of specific diseases and disorders.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Disease Coverage: The book provides detailed, evidence-based coverage of specific urologic diseases and disorders, including etiology and prevalence, clinical signs, diagnosis, treatment, prevention, prognosis, and controversies.
  • Broad Species Focus: The content is tailored to canine, feline, and exotic patients.
  • Foundational Review: Coverage includes a practical review of the anatomy and physiology of the urinary system.
  • Diagnostics and Therapeutics: It details the fundamentals of diagnostic testing and therapeutic techniques used in urology.
  • Clinical Utility: Designed as an easy-to-use, comprehensive clinical reference, it provides the essential knowledge for effective management of urologic diseases.

products.title: Necropsy Techniques for Examining Wildlife Samples
products.body_html:
Necropsy Techniques for Examining Wildlife Samples

This book is a practical, easily accessible guide of necropsy techniques for examining wildlife. Its goal is to equip the reader with the information necessary to conduct a forensic examination in order to reach a conclusive diagnosis of an animal’s death, while also understanding it in an ecological context.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Techniques: Chapters introduce the reader to the value of necropsy in studying wildlife, sample collection methods, cadaveric phenomena, and necropsy techniques for a variety of organisms ranging from invertebrates to mammals.
  • Peculiar Characteristics: The book addresses some of the peculiar characteristics of veterinary autopsy specific to different types of specimens.
  • Ecological Context: The ultimate goal is to equip the reader with information necessary to reach a conclusive diagnosis of an animal’s death, while also understanding it in an ecological context.
  • Broad Audience: An essential handbook for students and professionals of biology, zoology and veterinary medicine, as well as professionals who work in natural parks, wildlife rehabilitation centers, and biological or zoological parks.
  • Practical Format: This handbook provides a practical and easily accessible guide to necropsy techniques.

products.title: Leadership in Veterinary Medicine 1st Edition
products.body_html:
Leadership in Veterinary Medicine: Your Guide to Professional Success

This book provides both theoretical and practical information for veterinary professionals who are contemplating leadership or currently facing day-to-day leadership challenges. This much-needed book introduces and explores key leadership concepts in the veterinary context while encouraging self-reflection through real-world scenarios.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Concepts: Explores the principal areas of leadership for both veterinary professionals and for those leading veterinary professionals. It discusses various leadership styles, competencies, behaviors, and perspectives.
  • Essential Skills: Addresses topics such as leadership assessment, organizational dynamics, interpersonal communication, remote and virtual leadership, and collaboration skills.
  • Strategy and Team Building: Assists readers in developing strategy, leading change, creating effective teams, and improving staff engagement.
  • Real-World Scenarios: Each chapter outlines a particular leadership concept or issue and includes a topic summary, discussion questions, full references, and further reading suggestions.
  • Broad Audience: A must-read for all veterinary professionals in leadership posts, for those aspiring to be leaders, and for instructors in veterinary schools and veterinary nursing training organizations.

products.title: Layer Signals: A practical guide for poultry-oriented management
products.body_html:
Laying Hens: Your Guide to Reading Poultry Signals

This book is a practical guide that shows you how to pick up the signals given by your animals at an early stage, how to interpret them, and which action to take. It emphasizes that "Laying hens are not egg laying machines," and that proper care requires knowledge and the capability to use it in practice for optimal results.

Key Features

  • Practical Knowledge: The book presents practical knowledge of animal-oriented poultry farming in an easy, accessible format.
  • Reading Signals: It teaches you how to recognize the signals your chickens are giving about their health, surroundings, comfort, and happiness.
  • Problem Identification: It helps you identify abnormalities of the egg and trace this back to the cause. For example, it teaches the difference between abnormal, runny droppings and healthy caecal droppings.
  • Actionable Steps: The guide ensures you are armed with information to take the appropriate steps to get your flock back on track, enabling correct and efficient management.
  • Farm Assessment: It encourages you to know all the ins and outs of your own farm and be able to assess the impact management changes will have on your animals.

products.title: Lawrie's Meat Science (Woodhead Publishing Series in Food Science, Technology and Nutrition) 9th Edition
products.body_html:
Lawrie’s Meat Science, 9th Edition: The Classic Reference

This book continues to be a classic reference in the meat world, used by numerous generations of meat professionals since 1966. The new edition brings four new chapters and updated information related to the latest advances in meat animal breeding and technologies for meat preservation, processing, and packaging.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Scope: The book covers essential information and latest advances, from the initial meat animal’s growth and development to the time of slaughter, and to the processing technologies, packaging, and distribution until consumption.
  • New and Advanced Topics: Includes new information on improved added value of meat by-products for increased sustainability. It also presents the latest developments in organic meat and meat products and on cell-cultured meat and future market opportunities.
  • Core Industry Issues: Relevant aspects of meat composition, nutritional value, eating quality, consumer acceptance, safety, and sustainability issues are covered in detail.
  • Expert Compilation: The book features a compilation of chapters written by a select group of the most experienced and knowledgeable people in the meat field.
  • Best Practices: Provides best practices for sustainable animal production and meat processing.
  • Authenticity and Traceability: Methodologies for authenticity and traceability are provided, reflecting current industry standards.

products.title: Key Questions in Clinical Farm Animal Medicine, Volume 2
products.body_html:
Farm Animal Medicine: Your Self-Assessment Q&A
