This book provides a significant update and expansion to a leading laboratory reference, offering a practical, quick guide to laboratory test procedures routinely used in the veterinary setting. Now encompassing topics in all areas of clinical pathology, this book has been carefully formatted and written to put the essential information for veterinary technicians right at their fingertips.

Key Features

  • Expanded Coverage: The book now covers all areas of clinical pathology, with new chapters on microbiology and parasitology. It also newly covers quality assurance in the introductory chapter.
  • Comprehensive Procedures: It covers procedures in hematology, clinical chemistry, urinalysis, microbiology, parasitology, serology, and cytology.
  • Detailed Techniques: You'll find helpful information on proper blood collection and handling techniques, blood smear preparation and staining, and urinalysis procedures (physical, chemical, and sediment examination).
  • Cytology Sampling: The book covers cytology sample collection and smear preparation, including the feather, line, squash, modified squash, and starfish methods.
  • Enhanced Visuals: The new edition features larger and better-quality images and more images overall, with significant updates to information and equipment throughout.
  • Digital Resources: A companion website features case studies, crossword puzzles, figures from the book in PowerPoint, and additional figures not found in the book.
  • Broad Audience: Equally useful for veterinary technicians in training and in practice, this is an excellent companion to full textbooks.

products.title: Veterinary PCR Diagnostics
products.body_html:
Your Essential Guide to Veterinary PCR Diagnostics

This book is a valuable reference that discusses the basic concepts, chemistries, and instrumentation of standard and real-time PCR, and includes present applications and future perspectives for veterinary diagnostics. It is essential reading for all veterinary professionals interested in this modern diagnostic tool, as it pinpoints practical limitations and instructs the user in approaches that avoid common errors.

Key Features

  • Critical Pitfalls: The text highlights critical pitfalls in veterinary PCR diagnostics, including the choice of platform technologies for PCR diagnosis, the construction of optimized PCR primers and probes to ensure the highest specificity and sensitivity, and the avoidance and monitoring of contamination.
  • Methodology and Sampling: It provides guidance on correct sampling and efficient methods to preserve and release nucleic acids, as well as the maximization of PCR amplification efficiency.
  • Comprehensive Coverage: It discusses the basic concepts, chemistries, and instrumentation of standard and real-time PCR, and includes present applications and future perspectives for veterinary diagnostics.
  • Expert Insights: The content is based on extensive experience with PCR technology in both research and diagnostic applications, enabling the authors to pinpoint practical limitations and instruct the user in avoiding common errors.
  • Broad Audience: This book should be a valuable reference for all veterinary professionals interested in this modern diagnostic tool.

products.title: Veterinary Leadership: A Practical Guide for Practice Owners and Managers 1st Edition
products.body_html:
Veterinary Leadership: Your Practical Guide to Practice Management

This book is a practical resource delivering business tips on veterinary practice management, marketing, and more from a highly successful practice owner. It provides 10 core principles that any practice owner can learn and apply, which have served as the pillars of a successful practice ownership career. The book shows how to plot a better path forward for DVMs who often lack real freedom and abundance in their lives.

Key Features

  • 10 Core Principles: The book provides 10 core principles that any practice owner can learn and apply to lead a thriving hospital.
  • Actionable Lessons: Each chapter contains a specific lesson with personal anecdotes and ends with a set of action items to put that lesson into practice, allowing leaders to create their own Veterinary Practice Operating System (“VPOS”).
  • Business and Marketing: It includes information on topics such as trusting yourself and your instincts, understanding what marketing really means and how to do it in a way that gets results, and planning where you are and where you're going.
  • Leadership and Team Building: It covers building a leadership team that will help the practice and individuals reach their potential and getting your team involved by speaking clearly and helping everyone be part of something great.
  • Exit Strategy Focus: It offers guidance on running your practice as if you might have to sell it in the next six months, fostering an efficient and robust business model.
  • Broad Audience: An essential read for veterinary practice owners, associate DVMs, practice managers, medical directors, and anyone who wants to contribute to the long-term well-being of the veterinary profession.

products.title: Veterinary Clinical Pathology and Laboratory Diagnosis (Fully Illustrated)
products.body_html:
Your Comprehensive Guide to Veterinary Clinical Pathology and Diagnosis

This book is a vital resource that provides information for clinical pathology and laboratory diagnosis in one location, assisting veterinarians and disease investigation experts in their routine work. It addresses the need for rapid and specific diagnostic tools, providing guidance on both traditional methods and the use of modern techniques like enzyme immunoassay.

Key Features

  • Integrated Diagnostics: The book addresses the challenge of traditional methods (isolation and identification) by providing information on alternative approaches, such as detecting seroconversions and utilizing the Enzyme Immunoassay (EIA) technique for rapid diagnosis.
  • Disease Investigation: It provides the foundation for identifying causative agents and recommending effective therapeutic and preventive measures to control livestock and poultry diseases.
  • Regulatory and Safety Guidance: For the first time, this book provides regulatory and safety requirements for veterinary disease investigation, which is crucial for clinicians and field veterinarians.
  • Practical Application: The information is designed for use in the daily routine work of field veterinarians, helping them diagnose diseases and recommend control measures for livestock and poultry.
  • Foundational Knowledge: It covers the basics of traditional methods for diagnosing infectious diseases and highlights their limitations and success rates.

products.title: The Science of Animal Agriculture, 5th Edition
products.body_html:
The Science of Animal Agriculture, 5th Edition: Your Guide to Agricultural Production

This book provides a thorough introduction to basic science concepts involved in the production of agricultural animals. By combining scientific principles with practical applications, this proven resource clearly demonstrates how science and agriculture are integrally related.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Coverage: The text covers biological processes of agricultural animals—including reproduction, growth and development, and animal behavior—as well as concerns associated with production, such as nutrition, disease, and the latest in animal biotechnology.
  • Integrated Approach: It clearly demonstrates how scientific principles and practical applications are integrally related in the agricultural industry.
  • Key Issues: The author addresses key contemporary issues such as animal welfare, consumer concerns, and environmental considerations, offering students further insights into today’s agricultural industry.
  • Visual and Reader-Friendly: The book presents up-to-date information in a highly visual, reader-friendly manner.
  • Broad Audience: It is an essential resource for students seeking a thorough understanding of the science involved in agricultural production.

products.title: The Racehorse: A Veterinary Manual 2nd Edition
products.body_html:
The Racehorse: A Veterinary Manual, 2nd Edition

This book has become the definitive text for primary care of the Thoroughbred racehorse. Written by one of the world’s leading racehorse veterinary clinicians, it sets out best practice standards of diagnosis and management of all the major conditions likely to be encountered in racehorse clinical practice. This thoroughly updated second edition remains an invaluable resource for both clinicians and non-veterinarians in the racing industry.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Coverage: It comprehensively reviews diverse subjects such as pre-purchase assessment and exercise physiology, setting out best practice standards of diagnosis and management of all the major conditions.
  • New Chapters and Sections: This second edition introduces new chapters on a range of topics, including injury risk assessment and electrolyte and fluid therapy. It also features expanded sections on nutrition, rehabilitation, and sales radiography.
  • Best Practice Standards: The manual sets out best practice standards of diagnosis and management of all the major conditions likely to be encountered in racehorse clinical practice.
  • Updated Content: The book has been thoroughly updated and includes an array of new images and ready reference charts.
  • Broad Audience: It remains an invaluable resource for both clinicians and non-veterinarians in the racing industry.

products.title: The Merck Veterinary Manual 11th Edition
products.body_html:
The Merck Veterinary Manual (MVM): The Definitive Veterinary Classic

This completely revised and redesigned new edition of this veterinary classic covers all domesticated species and diseases in veterinary medicine worldwide. The new edition uses a two-column format and color throughout for easy-to-read text and tables, making this the definitive, go-to reference for veterinary professionals globally.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Coverage: This manual covers all domesticated species and diseases in veterinary medicine worldwide.
  • New and Expanded Content: It includes a new section on public health and zoonoses, expanded coverage of fish and aquaculture, and new chapters on backyard poultry, toxicologic workplace hazards, and smoke inhalation.
  • Emerging Topics: The book provides additional coverage of numerous new and emerging topics in veterinary medicine, ensuring the content is current and relevant.
  • Enhanced Design: The new edition uses a two-column format and color throughout for easy-to-read text and tables.
  • Visual Learning: Hundreds of color images enhance and illustrate the text, making complex information easier to absorb.

products.title: [February 14, 2025] The Laboratory Pig (Laboratory Animal Pocket Reference) 3rd edition
products.body_html:
The Laboratory Swine, 3rd Edition: Your Guide to Humane Care and Research

This book is a fully updated third edition that summarizes new insights in the field, raising the bar for humane care and use of pigs in research. It provides an overview with extensive references for animal caretakers, technicians, laboratory animal veterinarians, and investigators planning and performing studies on pigs.

Key Features

  • Welfare Focus: The book is updated with a special focus on refined methods for housing and handling pigs, reflecting the large developments made in welfare concepts of laboratory animals.
  • Research Protocols: It includes an updated description of commonly performed experimental and surgical procedures, reflecting the significant increase in publication activity and the prominence of pigs in both basic and applied research.
  • Comprehensive Coverage: It covers the humane care and use of pigs, from agricultural sources to genetically and microbiologically defined minipigs.
  • Practical Format: The small, practical, and accessible format makes this an easy "go-to" book, with easy-to-find information and high-quality color images.
  • Legacy of Excellence: Continuing its legacy as the premier reference on the care and use of pigs in the laboratory, this book is an essential tool for conducting high-quality research.

products.title: The Cutting Edge: Basic Veterinary Surgery Techniques, 3rd Edition
products.body_html:
The Cutting Edge, Basic Veterinary Surgery Techniques, 3rd Edition

This book provides a foundational and open-access platform to teach students the essential art of surgery without having a specific species in mind. Its goal is to provide veterinary students and new graduates with the tools to grasp the principles of surgery, along with a discussion of the limitations and complications of surgical procedures.

Key Features

  • Foundational Focus: It should be regarded as a basis for the inexperienced surgeon, providing the essential art of surgery rather than advanced techniques.
  • Open Access Design: This edition is designed for an open-access web-based platform, ensuring students worldwide will be able to use the information for their benefit while improving their surgical knowledge and skills.
  • Core Principles: The book provides tools to grasp the principles of surgery, along with a discussion of the limitations and complications of surgical procedures.
  • Expert Contributions: The material is prepared by various veterinary lecturers at renowned universities, ensuring high-quality, up-to-date information.
  • Historical Updates: It is an improvement of the previous editions, building on previously published work and translated from its original publication.

products.title: Technical Large Animal Emergency Rescue 1st Edition
products.body_html:
Your Essential Guide to Technical Large Animal Emergency Rescue

This book is a must-have reference for large animal rescue, providing a practical guide for safely rescuing and treating large animals in critical situations while maintaining the safety of both the animal and the rescuer. The book addresses the growing importance of safe large animal rescue, as owners of these pets or large financial investments demand safe rescue and treatment in emergency situations.

Key Features

  • Safety First: The book emphasizes maintaining the safety of both the animal and the rescuer during critical situations.
  • Emergency Protocols: It serves as a comprehensive guide for technical rescue and treatment of large animals in emergency situations.
  • Broad Audience: This book is a must-have reference for equine, large animal, and mixed animal veterinarians, zoo and wildlife veterinarians, vet techs, and emergency responders.
  • Addressing Demand: It responds to the prevailing attitude of large animal owners who demand the safe rescue and treatment of their animals.

products.title: Swine Production and Management 1st Edition
products.body_html:
Your Comprehensive Guide to Swine Management

This book elaborately covers all topics of swine management, including breeding, feeding, housing, health management, and pork production technology. The book is well supported by a large number of illustrations and tables, which makes the understanding of the text very simple and easy.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Coverage: It elaborately covers all topics of swine management, providing a complete overview of the industry.
  • Visual Learning: The book is well supported by a large number of illustrations and tables, which makes the understanding of the text very simple and easy.
  • Broad Audience: It will be very useful for all students as well as professionals involved in swine production.
  • Industry Focus: Topics include pork production technology and health management.

products.title: Rabbit Production, 10th Edition
products.body_html:
Your Essential Guide to Domesticated Rabbit Production, 10th Edition

This well-established book continues to provide a comprehensive overview of domesticated rabbit production, covering topics such as breeding, husbandry, feeding, and health. Now in its fully updated tenth edition, this book is an essential resource for anyone involved in rabbit production, from novice to experienced breeders, veterinarians, and industry professionals.

Key Features

  • Expanded Issues: The new edition includes an expanded consideration of important issues such as animal welfare and sustainable methods of production.
  • Specialized Chapters: Chapters relate specifically to meat production, pet rabbits, rabbit shows, and angora wool production, providing targeted knowledge for various industry segments.
  • Updated Information: It provides updates on worldwide production trends, figures, and new feed additive products.
  • Comprehensive Coverage: It covers all aspects of domesticated rabbit production, making it an essential resource for anyone involved in the rabbit industry.

products.title: Practical Human Behaviour Change for the Health and Welfare of Animals
products.body_html:
Your Practical Guide to Human Behaviour Change for Animal Welfare

This book is the practical guide to helping people change behavior for the welfare, wellbeing, and health of their animals. Grounded in evidence-based techniques and drawing on over 20 years of experience, this book enables readers to understand the underlying causes of human behavior toward animals and deliver the crucial skills to help people make needed changes.

Key Features

  • Crucial Techniques: The book details key behavioral change techniques, including the use of the Stages of Change model, Motivational Interviewing (MI), and skilled Active Listening, to support practical interventions for owner's behaviors (e.g., diet, exercise, weight control, and breeding).
  • Managing Difficult Conversations: It supports professionals through difficult conversations such as euthanasia, hoarding, and giving up ownership, reducing the psychological burden on workers and improving job satisfaction.
  • Effective Communication: It covers structuring conversations with a focus, developing understanding of the owner’s situation and experiences, working with ambivalence, and supporting people to prepare for change.
  • Practical Learning: To aid in reader comprehension, the book is complemented by case examples, analogies, and exercises. A supporting website provides worksheets and resources to help put skills into practice.
  • Action Planning: It includes guidance on preparing for action via goal setting and action planning, supporting people to move into making changes and and maintain change in the long-term.
  • Broad Audience: A valuable resource for veterinary surgeons, veterinary nurses, animal care providers, animal welfare and sanctuary workers, and individuals working in health, environmental, and trading standards.

products.title: Pathology of Pet and Aviary Birds 3rd Edition
products.body_html:
Pathology of Pet and Aviary Birds, 3rd Edition: Your Complete Avian Reference

This book delivers a comprehensive reference to gross and microscopic lesions found in birds and the clinical implications of these diseases. This revised third edition includes improved coverage of normal anatomy and advanced diagnostic techniques. It is an essential resource for veterinary pathologists and residents, avian practitioners, and veterinary students interested in the diseases and pathology of wild birds and those in avicultural collections.

Key Features

  • Extensive Visuals: The authors offer an extensive collection of more than 1,200 high-quality, full-color images that are annotated to bolster the text and benefit the reader.
  • Advanced Diagnostics: Includes improved coverage of normal anatomy and advanced diagnostic techniques, such as special stains, immunohistochemistry, in situ hybridization, and molecular diagnostics.
  • New Chapters: New chapters cover the postmortem examination; gross and microscopic anatomy; advanced diagnostics; and cytology.
  • Systematic Coverage: Chapters are intuitively organized by body system and address diseases of the liver, urinary system, reproductive system, cardiovascular system, nervous system, alimentary system, integument, and special senses.
  • Species-Specific Detail: Specific chapters address diseases of passerines, Columbidae, and raptors.
  • Quick Reference Tables: The book provides comprehensive tables of infectious diseases and published avian primers and IHC markers.
  • Cytology Introduction: Offers a thorough introduction to the preparation and interpretation of cytological samples.

products.title: Parasitism and Parasitic Control in Animals: Strategies for the Developing World
products.body_html:
Your Comprehensive Guide to Parasitism and Parasitic Control in Animals

This book brings together all the details needed to appropriately manage parasites in domestic animals. It provides comprehensive coverage of parasites, factors affecting their transmission, principles of parasite control, diagnosis, and assessment of parasitological information, starting with an overview of the fundamentals of parasitism.

Key Features

  • Effective Control Methods: The text covers a range of methods for effective parasite control, including chemotherapy, nutrition, pasture management, selective breeding, and vaccination.
  • Drug Resistance Focus: It considers drug resistance and the challenges posed by parasitic infections, providing up-to-date information on mitigation strategies.
  • Broad Species Coverage: It includes cattle, buffalo, sheep, goat, horses, donkeys, dogs, cats, poultry, pigs, and fish, as well as wild animals in the context of intermediate hosts, vectors, or as reservoirs of infection.
  • Clinical Resources: With numerous new case histories and maps showing the spread of anthelmintic resistance, this textbook is an essential guide for veterinary practitioners, students, and technicians.
  • Zoonotic Importance: It begins with an overview of the fundamentals of parasitism, including a review of the parasites of zoonotic importance.
  • Global Relevance: An invaluable resource for anyone working with these parasites, particularly in developing countries.

products.title: Parasitic Diseases of Goats
products.body_html:
Your Comprehensive Guide to Parasitic Diseases of Goats

This book provides a comprehensive exploration of parasitic infections affecting goats and their impact on various organ systems. It covers a wide range of parasitic diseases and is an essential resource for veterinarians, researchers, students, and professionals in parasitology and veterinary medicine.

Key Features

  • Organ System Coverage: The book covers parasitic diseases affecting the gastrointestinal, respiratory, cardiovascular, nervous, and urogenital systems, as well as the liver, pancreas, skin, and musculoskeletal system.
  • Diagnosis and Treatment: It includes detailed descriptions of parasite-related diseases, their pathogenesis, diagnostic methods, and treatment strategies to improve goat health and management.
  • Comprehensive Resource: It is an essential resource for veterinarians, researchers, students, and professionals in parasitology and veterinary medicine.
  • In-Depth Exploration: The book provides a comprehensive exploration of parasitic infections affecting goats, offering valuable insights into the etiology, symptoms, and pathophysiology of these infections.

products.title: One Health for Veterinary Nurses and Technicians: An Introduction
products.body_html:
One Health for Veterinary Nurses and Technicians

This book provides information and guidance for veterinary nurses in understanding both the scope of the One Health concept and their role within it. Beginning with an overview of the global issues faced, this book focuses on providing an insight into how One Health can be applied within a veterinary practice and in the local community.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Coverage: It covers both communicable and non-communicable disease, as well as public health, climate change, sustainability, and the importance of the human-animal bond.
  • Practical Application: The book focuses on providing an insight into how One Health can be applied within a veterinary practice and in the local community, translating this important concept for veterinary nurses and their clients.
  • Case Studies and Discussion: It includes case studies to help translate theory into practice and provides questions to help promote discussion and implement change.
  • Global Relevance: Although written by contributors based in the United Kingdom, the content is applicable to those working internationally within a veterinary environment and will also be of interest to other allied healthcare professionals.
  • Broad Scope: The book reviews the interrelations between humans, animals, and their environment, making it an approachable and usable introduction for veterinary nurses and students in both clinical and non-clinical environments.

products.title: Nutrient Requirements of Small Ruminants: Sheep, Goats, Cervids, and New World Camelids
products.body_html:
Nutrient Requirements of Small Ruminants: Your Essential Guide

This new book updates previous publications to provide an evaluation of the scientific literature on the nutrient requirements of small ruminants in all stages of life. It brings together a summary of the latest data with new and expanded information on the composition of feeds commonly consumed by domestic and wild small ruminants. The book is written to ensure that diets of small ruminants contain adequate amounts of nutrients for optimal health and performance.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Evaluation: This book provides an evaluation of the scientific literature on the nutrient requirements of small ruminants in all stages of life, covering breed, age, exercise, pregnancy, and lactation.
  • Expanded Species Coverage: For the first time, this authoritative reference work includes information on cervids and camelids, alongside sheep and goats.
  • Environmental Factors: The book addresses the effects of the environment, feed additives, and metabolism modifiers on nutrient requirements.
  • Practical and Technical Reference: It is designed as both a practical and a technical reference book to ensure diets contain adequate amounts of nutrients and that excessive intakes do not inhibit performance or impair health.
  • Broad Audience: Primarily intended for animal nutritionists, veterinarians, and other scientists, some sections will be useful to individual sheep and goat owners and managers and to those responsible for the care and management of wildlife species.

products.title: Nanobiotechnology for the Livestock Industry: Animal Health and Nutrition 1st Edition
products.body_html:
Nanobiotechnology for the Livestock Industry: Animal Health and Nutrition

This book delivers a multidisciplinary reference on nanobiotechnology applications in the livestock industry, including farming practices, healthcare, breeding, market analysis, and biosafety. The book explores nanobiotechnology's role in livestock handling, hygiene maintenance, and feed/nutrient delivery, making it a comprehensive guide for the future of animal production.

Key Features

  • Healthcare Applications: It covers healthcare practices utilizing nanobiotechnology, such as maintaining and monitoring livestock health, diagnosis and treatment of disease, monitoring drug delivery, optimizing breeding patterns, and cryopreservation of sperm and eggs.
  • Problem Management: It discusses livestock diseases and major handling mistakes in livestock treatment, providing potential solutions.
  • Industry and Market Analysis: Provides a detailed explanation of food safety technologies and food regulation policies, and presents a detailed analysis of market growth and trends related to the livestock industry.
  • Regulation and Safety: Includes biosafety and bioregulation of the nanobiotechnological tools used to produce transgenic animals.
  • Holistic Coverage: The book explores nanobiotechnology's role in hygiene maintenance and feed/nutrient delivery, offering a holistic view of its impact.

products.title: Multimodal Management of Canine Osteoarthritis 2nd Edition
products.body_html:
Multimodal Management of Canine Osteoarthritis, 2nd Edition

This book takes an evidence-based approach to the canine patient with osteoarthritis (OA), focusing on the conservative management of the disease through a variety of means: multiple drugs, agents, adjuncts, and delivery methods. It is a highly visual guide that presents the best available medicine by overlapping two three-pointed triangles of management: medical and non-medical.

Key Features

  • Major New Chapter: The completely updated new edition offers a major new chapter on Regenerative Medicine in collaboration with Drs. Sherman Canapp and Brittany Jean Carr.
  • Focus on Conservative Management: While acknowledging the role of surgical intervention for joint stabilization, the major focus is on the conservative management of OA.
  • Evidence-Based Approach: The book pursues the objective of the best available medicine by using a wide variety of evidence-based medical and non-medical strategies.
  • Visual Framework: A clear and visual approach is taken with the overlapping of two three-pointed triangles of management: medical and non-medical.
  • Broad Audience: It is recommended for any small animal veterinary practitioner, as well as researchers and students of the RCVS CertAVP.

products.title: Mosby’s® Manual of Diagnostic and Laboratory Tests 7th Edition
products.body_html:
Mosby’s Manual of Diagnostic and Laboratory Tests, 7th Edition

This book is a comprehensive, one-stop resource that provides clear, concise, and consistent coverage of the most commonly performed diagnostic and laboratory tests. Selected as a Doody’s Core Titles® 2024, this manual makes understanding and performing tests, interpreting lab results, and performing patient teaching easier for users in academic and clinical settings alike.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Presentation: The comprehensive and consistent presentation of tests follows a sequence that best simulates priorities in clinical practice.
  • Clinical Relevance: "Test Results and Clinical Significance" sections describe the significance of test findings and discuss the pathophysiology of the disease process. A dedicated section on "Diagnostic Testing for Most Common Diseases" highlights the integration of medical testing as it relates to a specific disease.
  • Unique Learning Aids: Unique features include "Clinical Priorities" boxes (emphasizing procedure considerations), "Critical Values" sections (indicating values of particular significance), and "Home Care Responsibilities" boxes (focusing on post-test factors).
  • New Content: Includes more than 25 new tests focusing mainly on the areas of blood studies and x-ray studies. A "Common Reference Range" section on the inside front cover provides quick access to essential information.
  • Efficient Navigation: A "Quick Tips for Using this Manual" section helps you use the manual easily and efficiently.
  • Cross-Referencing: "Related Tests" sections list additional tests that provide similar or confirmatory information, or tests used to evaluate the same organ, disease process, or symptom complex.
  • Broad Focus: "Age-Related Concerns" boxes address pediatric and geriatric priorities, and results are provided in SI units in addition to others, when applicable.
  • Visual and Design: The book features a full-color design and illustrations that clarify key concepts. Updated new images throughout the manual reflect the latest developments in the field.

products.title: Meat Inspection 1st Edition
products.body_html:
Meat Inspection: Your Comprehensive Guide to Pathoanatomy

This book is the most comprehensive book covering the subject of meat inspection in today's market. Combining the pathoanatomic basis of lesions with concise explanations of pathogenesis and etiology, this book provides a foundation for the uniform assessment of lesions based on current meat hygiene legislation. It is an indispensable tool for professionals and veterinarians who work with assessing and diagnosing lesions in production animals.

Key Features

  • Extensive Visuals: The text is supplemented by almost 1,500 color illustrations and matching texts, making this an invaluable diagnostic resource.
  • Systematic Organization: Chapters 1 and 2 cover general conditions of production animals, and the following 16 chapters describe lesions in the various organ systems.
  • Cross-Disciplinary Topics: The remaining four chapters cover key cross-disciplinary areas of meat inspection, such as pyaemia, granulomatous and pyogranulomatous inflammations, forensic pathology, animal welfare, and neoplasms.
  • Practical Focus: The book focuses on diseases and types of lesions most commonly found in production mammals at meat inspection.
  • Quick Reference: The comprehensive index guarantees quick reference searches on specific subjects.
  • Broad Audience: It will be a valuable tool for hunters, researchers, and other persons with an interest in these animals, and is vital to anyone interested in pathobiological issues.

products.title: Livestock Ration Formulation for Dairy Cattle and Buffalo 1st Edition
products.body_html:
Livestock Ration Formulation for Dairy Cattle and Buffalo: Your Guide to Optimized Feeding

This book provides an interdisciplinary, integrative perspective and optimization on dairy cattle feed formulation problem-solving. It is a step forward in providing least-cost diet formulation based on the nutrient requirements of cattle and buffalo. This resource helps dairy farmers by introducing them to the right frequency and amount of balanced diet, leading to decreased feeding costs and increased income.

Key Features

  • Farmer-Centric Guidance: It is a good reference for local dairy farmers, introducing them to the right frequency and right amount of balanced diet to be fed to cattle and buffaloes at different production cycles.
  • Scientific Optimization Models: It helps animal nutritionists develop low-budget diets by applying Linear and Goal programming models, with one model for non-pregnant dairy buffalo solved using the Hybrid Real Coded Genetic Algorithm (RGA).
  • Software Development Platform: The book provides a basic platform and solutions to build software and Android applications for least-cost ration formulation for end-users, based on the data and algorithms used in the book.
  • Nutrient Focus: It focuses on fulfilling nutrient requirements in terms of crude protein (CP), total digestible nutrient (TDN), calcium (Ca), and phosphorus (P), using established national and international guidelines (ICAR, 2013 and NRC, 2001).
  • Advanced Techniques: The book incorporates a good balance between coding/programming and animal nutrition towards the application of soft computing techniques to improve the quality of the solution due to the rigidity of the constraints.

products.title: Large Animal Parasitology Procedures for Veterinary Technicians 1st Edition
products.body_html:
Large Animal Parasitology Procedures for Veterinary Technicians

This book is a comprehensive, illustrated reference that provides the most sensitive diagnostic procedures for internal parasites of domestic animals, focusing on the Modified Wisconsin Sugar Flotation Method. It offers detailed, step-by-step instructions and bullet-point guidance, making it an essential resource for veterinary technicians and students.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Coverage: The book covers parasitic nematodes, cestodes, coccidian oocysts, and trematode egg recoveries, identification, and enumeration, along with treatment strategies for five separate categories of animal patients.
  • Species Inclusion: Parasites of equine, large and small ruminants (including alpaca), swine, poultry, and hoofed wildlife patients are included, with full-color images for quick identification.
  • Diagnostic Techniques: It provides a detailed guide to fecal examination procedures, comparing the Modified Wisconsin Sugar Flotation method with gross examination, smear, sedimentation, and other techniques. It also includes methods for fluke egg recovery and the Baermann technique for lungworm larvae recovery.
  • Clinical Relevance: The text covers potential sources for infection, the seasonality of the infection, possible environmental recontamination, and control strategies with suggestions to prevent reoccurrences.
  • Visual Learning: Each species section is heavily illustrated with comparative images to aid the technician in quickly identifying the parasite and life cycle stage, along with an assessment of the life cycle stage and discussion of zoonotic potential.
  • Foundational Knowledge: Information includes the definition and economic importance of parasitisms, details on the epidemiology of parasitic enteritis, and the basics of protozoology, helminthology, and applied veterinary parasitology.

products.title: Junqueira's Basic Histology: Text and Atlas 14th Edition
products.body_html:
Junqueira's Basic Histology, 14th Edition: The Definitive Visual Guide

For more than three decades, this book has been unmatched in its ability to explain the function of cell and tissue structure in the human body. Updated to reflect the latest research and enhanced with more than 1,000 illustrations, the Fourteenth Edition reflects the most comprehensive and modern approach to understanding medical histology available anywhere.

Key Features

  • Complete Coverage: This well-regarded classic is distinguished by chapters focusing on the cytoplasmic and nuclear compartment of the cell, the four basic tissues that form the organs, and each organ system.
  • Enhanced Learning Tools: New chapter-ending multiple-choice questions and clinical vignettes have been added to each chapter to review must-know material and provide clinical context.
  • Unmatched Visuals: The book is beautifully illustrated with more than 1,000 illustrations, most in full-color. Full-color micrographs comprise a complete atlas of tissue sections, and drawings provide just the right level of detail to reinforce key concepts.
  • Concise Summaries: In response to reader demand, the legends are now concise, stand-alone summaries of the illustrations, facilitating quick comprehension and retention of text material.
  • Trusted Resource: It has been selected as a Doody's Core Title for 2017, confirming its status as an authoritative and essential resource in the field.

products.title: Inventory Management for Veterinary Professionals 1st Edition
products.body_html:
Your Practical Roadmap for Veterinary Inventory Management 

This book provides a thorough introduction to the logistics of effective and efficient veterinary inventory management. Designed for any employee of a veterinary practice, it covers strategies and tactics for all major aspects of inventory management, offering veterinary professionals a practical roadmap for this key business operation.

Key Features

  • Holistic Approach: The book emphasizes both the "how" and the "why" of developing effective inventory management systems, covering theory, strategies, and practical incorporation into your practice.
  • Detailed Discussion: It includes detailed discussion of topics such as the flow of inventory through the practice, forecasting, ordering, troubleshooting, and how to receive and restock, organize, price, and sell inventory.
  • Controlled Substances: Includes a vital chapter on setting and executing inventory management protocols around controlled substances.
  • Practical Guidance: Offers advice on how to set up an inventory action plan, providing a real-world perspective with stories drawing on the author's experience.
  • Digital Resources: A companion website provides additional tools, resources, and self-assessment questions.
  • Broad Audience: Ideal for any veterinary professional, including practice managers, receptionists, assistants, technicians, and practice owners.

products.title: Introduction to Animal Behavior and Veterinary Behavioral Medicine 1st Edition
products.body_html:
Your Essential Guide to Veterinary Behavioral Medicine

This book offers a comprehensive overview of the key concepts underlying the behavior of multiple animal species before demonstrating how to apply these concepts clinically. This indispensable resource helps refine diagnoses, facilitate communication with patients, and ultimately deepen your understanding of patient needs.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Coverage: It provides comprehensive coverage of companion animal behavior and additional coverage of livestock and wild animal behavior.
  • Foundational Knowledge: Includes detailed discussions of topics such as social development, animal learning, and applied behavior analysis.
  • Clinical Application: Offers an in-depth review of diagnosis and treatment strategies for common behavior disorders in companion animals, extending to various additional species.
  • Digital Resources: A companion website offers videos, handouts for downloading, and links to pertinent scientific articles and informative websites.
  • Broad Audience: Ideal preparation for veterinary medical students as part of “day one readiness” and for veterinary practitioners looking for a solid foundation in animal behavior and the treatment of key issues.

products.title: Integrative Veterinary Medicine 1st Edition
products.body_html:
Your Clinical Guide to Integrative Veterinary Medicine 🐾

This book provides a clinically oriented, evidence-based guide to integrating complementary and conventional therapies into veterinary practice. It draws information on modalities such as acupuncture, manual therapies, and herbal medicine into a single resource, demonstrating how to use them effectively in your practice.

Key Features

  • Integrated Modalities: The book covers acupuncture, manual therapies, botanical and herbal medicine, integrative nutrition, and physical rehabilitation, providing a comprehensive framework for patient treatment.
  • Evidence-Based Practice: Rooted in evidence-based medicine, it demonstrates how to use these modalities in veterinary practice, ensuring clinically sound application.
  • Acupuncture Detailed: Find detailed information on the anatomy and physiology of acupuncture, including soft tissue and neurologic concepts, and Traditional Chinese theory (Yin and Yang, Five Element Theory, and The Meridians).
  • Herbal Medicine: The book explores the origins and major systems of herbal therapy with selected evidence-based interventions, adverse events, herb-drug interactions, supplement evaluation, and regulation.
  • Current Nutritional Trends: It discusses modern trends in nutrition, such as raw diets, home-prepared diets, grain-free diets, and owner perception.
  • Digital Resources: A companion website offers video clips showing acupuncture techniques, enhancing the practical application of the text.
  • Broad Audience: An essential reference for any veterinary practitioner wishing to use integrative techniques in their practices, as well as veterinary students, academics, and researchers.

products.title: Integrative Medicine in Veterinary Practice 1st Edition
products.body_html:
Integrative Medicine in Veterinary Practice: Your Team Guide

This book is a unique resource designed to introduce the basic concepts of ten different integrative modalities to all members of the hospital team. It provides a seamless way to incorporate integrative medicine into everyday practice, covering everything from patient benefits and return on investment to staff training and client education.

Key Features

  • Team-Wide Implementation: The book is designed for all veterinary hospital team members, from customer service representatives to veterinary assistants/technicians, practice managers, and veterinarians, ensuring a unified, hospital-wide approach.
  • Key Modalities Covered: It provides a basic understanding of ten modalities, with sample topics including Photobiomodulation (light, laser specifics, supplies, and techniques), Veterinary Spinal Manipulation Therapy (VSMT), and Acupuncture (point selection, safety, and practical applications).
  • Business and Training Tools: It walks managers through staff training, discusses return on investment, and provides client education materials. It also informs veterinarians of available courses and suggested reading materials.
  • Flexible Approach: The text emphasizes that integrative medicine is not an all-or-nothing concept; therapies can be used individually or in combination as part of a multimodal approach.
  • Supplemental Resources: Supplemental web-based documents and presentations increase the ease with which staff are trained and clients are educated.

products.title: Infectious and Parasitic Diseases of Animals in Developing Countries 1st Edition
products.body_html:
A Global Perspective on Animal Diseases

This book presents a list of important animal diseases that occur in developing nations, offering an alternative view of these diseases based on the experience of scientists from those regions. It addresses a significant gap in the literature where most widely used textbooks reflect American and/or European views of specific diseases. The main objective of this book is to provide high-quality literature of international standards for veterinary students, practicing veterinarians, and veterinary diagnosticians in developing and underdeveloped countries.

Key Features

  • Regional Expertise: Written predominantly by experienced scientists and professors from developing countries, the book offers unique insights into the manifestation of diseases in their specific regions.
  • High-Quality Literature: The book is designed to provide high-quality literature of international standards for veterinary students and practitioners in developing and underdeveloped countries.
  • Alternative Viewpoint: It offers an alternative view of important diseases of animals, which may differ from the perspective presented in widely used international textbooks.
  • Target Audience: An essential text for veterinary students, practicing veterinarians, and veterinary diagnosticians in developing and underdeveloped nations.
  • Disease Focus: It presents a list of important infectious and parasitic diseases of domestic and/or wild animals.

products.title: Improving rumen function (Burleigh Dodds Series in Agricultural Science, 83) Illustrated Edition
products.body_html:
Optimizing Rumen Function for Sustainable Livestock Production

This collection reviews what we know about rumen microbiota and the role of nutritional strategies in optimising their function for more sustainable livestock production. Major advances in analytical techniques and genomics have transformed our understanding of rumen microbiology, which is of critical importance since rumen function affects nutritional efficiency, emissions from ruminants (such as methane and nitrous oxide), and animal health.

Key Features

  • Microbiome Analysis: Part 1 summarises advances in methods for analysing the rumen microbiome, ensuring you have the latest tools and knowledge for research.
  • Microbial Roles: Part 2 reviews recent research on the role of different types of rumen microbiota, such as bacteria, archaea, anaerobic fungi, and viruses, as well as the rumen wall microbial community.
  • Nutrient Processing: Part 3 discusses the way the rumen processes nutrients such as fibre and protein, as well as key outputs such as energy, lipids, and methane emissions.
  • Nutritional Strategies: Part 4 explores nutritional strategies to optimise rumen function, including the role of pasture, silage, cereal feed, plant secondary compounds, and probiotics.
  • Sustainability Focus: The book ties advanced microbial understanding directly to nutritional efficiency and the reduction of environmental emissions from ruminants, supporting sustainable livestock production.

products.title: Field Manual for Small Animal Medicine 1st Edition
products.body_html:
Your Essential Guide to Veterinary Medicine in Resource-Limited Environments

This book offers the only comprehensive resource for best practices when practicing veterinary medicine outside the traditional hospital or clinic setting. It integrates practical and cost-effective protocols where the ideal solution may not be available, making it an essential tool for anyone working in resource-limited environments.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Field Protocols: It integrates practical and cost-effective protocols for delivering veterinary care outside the traditional hospital or clinic setting.
  • Vital Topics: It presents information on vital topics such as operating a field spay/neuter clinic, emergency sheltering, sanitation and surgical asepsis, preventive care practices, zoonotic diseases, and euthanasia.
  • Quick Reference: The book serves as a quick reference guide for common surgical procedures, cytology interpretation, anesthesia and treatment protocols, and drug dosing.
  • Broad Scope: The book offers the only comprehensive resource for best practices when practicing veterinary medicine in resource-limited environments.

products.title: Farmed Animals on Film: A Manifesto for a New Ethic (The Palgrave Macmillan Animal Ethics Series)
products.body_html:
Your Essential Reference for Equine Breeding and Nutrition

This volume offers the latest research-based findings to equip professionals involved in the breeding and raising of horses. This unique and easy-to-read reference considers the links between health, proper dietary treatment, and management practices to increase our understanding of the needs of growing horses across their many roles and categories.

Key Features

  • Life Stage Coverage: The collection starts with a discussion of pregnant and lactating mares, followed by details on foal development, nutritional requirements, and feeding practices under different conditions.
  • Comprehensive Management: It includes special sections on young horses in training, parasite control, and addresses health risks related to both nutrition and exercise.
  • Nutritional Focus: The book highlights various innovations in equine nutrition and management to ensure animal wellbeing and fills a literature gap to prevent health consequences and strengthen performance and physical development.
  • Expert Authorship: Contributions were carefully selected and prepared by leading experts in their fields, ensuring authoritative and reliable guidance.
  • Broad Audience: This essential knowledge benefits veterinarians, animal nutritionists, and all stakeholders and people working in the horse industry.

products.title: Encyclopedia of Veterinary Science
products.body_html:
Your Foundational Guide to Veterinary Science

This book is a comprehensive introduction to veterinary science, giving a strong basis in this dynamic space for those preparing for careers as veterinary specialists or researchers. Veterinary clinical practice is both an art and a science, requiring a comprehensive understanding of numerous scholarly disciplines, including math, biology, chemistry, and physical science.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Foundation: The text outlines animal cell and tissue physiology, with dedicated sections devoted to individual body structures to allow for simpler understanding.
  • Essential Themes: The authors explore significant themes like nutrition, illness, and surgeries, the cost review of systems, wellbeing, and professionalism.
  • Practical Application: Throughout the paper, real-life models are incorporated with content material to offer pragmatic context, providing a link between scholarly disciplines and clinical practice.
  • Broad Species Exposure: Both small and large animals are included to expose learners to different cases they might experience in the field.
  • Professional Skills: The book emphasizes that veterinary medicine requires great communication skills, cooperative skills, and empathy for individuals and animals.

products.title: Ecotoxicology of Amphibians and Reptiles 2nd Edition
products.body_html:
Ecotoxicology of Amphibians and Reptiles, 2nd Edition

Building on the success of its popular predecessor, this second edition presents newly available findings on amphibian and reptile species, which are increasingly important environmental indicators. This comprehensive text covers nearly twice as many topics as the first edition, incorporating recent developments in the ecotoxicology of these vital animal groups.

Key Features

  • Expanded Coverage: The second edition significantly expands the field's coverage, including nearly twice as many topics as the first, reflecting recent developments and newly available research findings.
  • Environmental Indicators: The book focuses on species that are important environmental indicators, highlighting their sensitivity to and role in assessing environmental health.
  • State-of-the-Art Research: It synthesizes the most current findings in the ecotoxicology of amphibians and reptiles, providing an essential resource for researchers and environmental scientists.
  • Broad Audience: This updated edition appeals to a wide audience, including environmental managers, biologists, and anyone concerned with the health of these sensitive animal populations.

products.title: Domestic Animal Behavior for Veterinarians and Animal Scientists 7th Edition
products.body_html:
Domestic Animal Behavior for Veterinarians and Animal Scientists, 7th Edition

This book is a fully updated revision of a popular, classic text offering a thorough understanding of the normal behavior of domestic animals. Maintaining the foundation of earlier editions, this comprehensive resource examines key behavior issues, from communication to social structure, and integrates the very latest information and new knowledge in the field.

Key Features

  • Enhanced Coverage: The Seventh Edition adds enhanced coverage of behavioral genetics, animal cognition, and learning. It includes major additions on chicken and donkey behavior as well as the microbiome.
  • Comprehensive Topics: Chapters examine key behavior issues, including communication patterns, social behavior, sleep and activity patterns, and the detection of emotions in others. It also covers sexual behavior, maternal behavior, and the role of genetics, environment, and the microbiome in behavior.
  • Problem Behaviors: The book addresses behavioral problems such as cribbing, offspring rejection, and anxiety, as well as pain- and fear-induced aggression.
  • Species-Specific Focus: Each chapter covers a wide variety of farm and companion animals, including dogs, cats, horses, pigs, sheep, cattle, and goats, with the cognitive skills of different species discussed in the learning chapter.
  • Digital Resources: To aid in reader comprehension and assist in self-learning, a companion website provides review questions and answers and the figures from the book in PowerPoint.
  • Broad Audience: An essential reference for students of animal science and veterinary students, as well as qualified veterinarians and animal scientists.

products.title: Dogs Demystified: An A-to-Z Guide to All Things Canine
products.body_html:
Your All-Encompassing Guide to the Canine World

This book is an all-encompassing and fun reference from an award-winning scientist and dog lover. The encyclopedic entries cover everything related to dog care, dog-human relationships, and dog behavior, cognition, and emotions, making this the accessible book that every dog lover should have.

Key Features

  • A-Through-Z Entries: In concise, readable A-through-Z entries, the book covers everything from aggression to pack formation to zoomies, and explores why dogs do what they do.
  • Understanding Dogs: It teaches you how to meet any dog eye-to-eye, nose-to-nose, and ear-to-ear to understand their world better.
  • Unique Personalities: The book explores how tuning in to a dog’s unique personality leads to happier dogs and happier human companions.
  • Scientifically Accessible: Written by an expert who is known for turning cutting-edge science into practical, reader-friendly information.

products.title: Discovering Your Dog: New Information on How to Give Your Canine Pal a Longer, Healthier Life.
products.body_html:
Your Guide to a Long, Healthy, and Active Life for Your Dog

This book is a fascinating, fun-to-read resource that provides scientifically-based information to help your dog live a long, healthy, and active life. By enhancing your knowledge, you'll find new and sometimes surprising information to strengthen your relationship with your canine companion.

Key Features

  • Scientifically-Based Information: The content is built on scientifically-based information to ensure you are receiving the most reliable guidance.
  • Relationship Focus: The book shows you how to strengthen your relationships with dogs, which, in turn, teach us so much about life and love.
  • Practical Knowledge: You’ll find new and sometimes surprising information to enhance the lives of every dog with which you share your life.
  • Engaging Read: The book is designed to be fascinating and fun to read.
  • Core Goal: It aims to help your dog live a long, healthy, and active life.

products.title: Complementary Medicine for Veterinary Technicians and Nurses 2nd Edition
products.body_html:
Your Practical Guide to Complementary Veterinary Medicine

This book is a timely update of a practical reference, providing a broad overview of complementary veterinary medicine designed for technicians and nurses. It covers the most commonly used complementary modalities, with an explanation of each modality, its historical background, procedure guidelines, and usefulness, along with practical tips.

Key Features

  • Wide Range of Modalities: A range of both common and lesser-known modalities are covered, including physical therapy, holistic nutrition, acupuncture, chiropractic, herbal medicine, homeopathy, aromatherapy, and grief counseling.
  • Integrative Approach: The book outlines the respective roles of technicians and veterinarians throughout, providing thorough coverage of integrative veterinary medicine in a user-friendly, digestible format.
  • Practical Applications: It includes practical tips and covers advanced topics such as cold laser therapy, magnetic therapy, ozone therapy, prolotherapy, detoxification, and nutraceuticals.
  • Clinical Resources: The book provides clinically-relevant patient history and release forms, a glossary of terms, quick reference charts, and contact information for additional resources and training.
  • Skill Development: The text enables readers to assist with procedures associated with holistic medicine and knowledgeably discuss treatment options with clients.
  • Broad Audience: An essential resource for veterinary technicians and nurses, along with veterinarians and dedicated pet owners who wish to move beyond basic consumer resources.

products.title: Comparative Mammalian Immunology: The Evolution and Diversity of the Immune Systems of Mammals (Developments in Immunology) 1st Edition
products.body_html:
Your Guide to Comparative Mammalian Immunology

This book provides a comprehensive review of the current knowledge of mammalian immune systems from a comparative viewpoint. It elucidates the complex, but coordinated and controlled series of interactions involving cells and molecules that has evolved to protect the host against disease. It utilizes the most recent studies on genomic sequences to identify both common and unique features of each mammal's immune system.

Key Features

  • Diverse Species Coverage: This reference encompasses recent work on the immune systems of marine mammals, bats, and marsupials in addition to other lesser-known species. It also includes the immune systems of humans and laboratory mice as components of chapters on primates and rodents, respectively.
  • Evolutionary Insights: It shows the clear patterns of emergence of different immunologic traits among the diverse orders of mammals.
  • Mechanisms of Survival: The book demonstrates multiple diverse pathways and mechanisms to optimize resistance and survival in the face of infectious diseases.
  • Genomic Analysis: It makes use of the most recent studies on the genomic sequences of mammals to identify both common and unique features of each mammal's immune system.
  • Comprehensive Review: It serves as a comprehensive review of the current state of knowledge of the immune system of each mammalian order.

products.title: Clinical Pathology and Laboratory Techniques for Veterinary Technicians 2nd Edition
products.body_html:
Clinical Pathology and Laboratory Techniques for Veterinary Technicians, 2nd Edition

This newly revised and updated Second Edition is an inclusive, practical reference on laboratory procedures pertaining to small animals, horses, and cattle. The text clarifies "how-to" information while also discussing the importance of "why" laboratory procedures are performed in a particular way, enabling readers to gain a true understanding of the topics discussed.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Coverage: This book provides information on hematology, hemostasis, clinical chemistry, urinalysis, parasitology, endocrine testing, and quality assurance across small animals, horses, and cattle.
  • Technique and Rationale: It clarifies "how-to" information while also discussing the importance of "why" laboratory procedures are performed, providing an essential link between theory and practice.
  • Laboratory Procedures: Topics include sample collection, handling, and quality assurance to ensure valid test results, as well as in-house parasitology procedures and common endocrinopathies.
  • Visual Learning: High-quality photographs labeled with magnification and stain information, which clearly depict cellular morphology, inclusions, and infectious organisms, are included throughout each chapter.
  • Learning Aids: The text also offers key objectives, technician tip boxes, case examples, and a glossary of key terms.
  • Online Resources: A companion website provides instructor questions and an answer key to multiple-choice questions in the book.
  • Broad Audience: An essential resource for students enrolled in veterinary technology programs and veterinary colleges, and a vital guide for clinical pathology courses.

products.title: Clinical immunodermatology in small animals
products.body_html:
A Unique and Integrated Guide to Dermatology and Immunology

This book is an innovative work written by authors specialized in the field, offering a truly unique resource by providing a joint perspective on the subjects of Dermatology and Immunology. The combination of these two subjects makes this work an indispensable tool for readers, allowing them to tackle each pathology encountered using an informed approach that is unique within the current literature.

Key Features

  • Unique Integration: Uniquely, this book provides a joint perspective on the subjects of Dermatology and Immunology, allowing for a holistic understanding of skin diseases.
  • Indispensable Tool: The combination of the two subjects makes this work an indispensable tool for readers.
  • Informed Approach: It allows readers to tackle each pathology encountered using an informed approach that is unique within the current literature.
  • Expert Authorship: This innovative work is written by authors specialized in the field.

products.title: Casarett & Doull's Toxicology: The Basic Science of Poisons, 9th Edition 9th Edition
products.body_html:
Toxicology’s Gold-Standard Reference, 9th Edition

This book is the gold-standard text in toxicology, completely updated to reflect the latest breakthroughs and discoveries. Selected as a Doody’s Core Title® for 2024 and 2022, this book equips you with an unsurpassed understanding of modern toxicology, including the key principles, concepts, and mechanisms that are the foundation of the discipline.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Coverage: The book is logically divided into seven sections: General Principles of Toxicology, Disposition of Toxicants, Non-Organ Directed Toxicity, Target Organ Toxicity, Toxic Agents, Environmental Toxicology, and Applications of Toxicology.
  • Cutting-Edge Topics: The book includes dynamic new coverage of topics such as gene regulation, signaling pathways, transgenic mice, genomics, proteomics, epigenetics, exposome, microbiota, adverse outcome pathways, high-content screening, computational toxicology, and organ-on-a-chip in understanding mechanisms of toxicity.
  • Systemic Responses: It offers the most up-to-date, revealing, and in-depth look at the systemic responses of toxic substance available anywhere.
  • Expert Authorship: Many new contributors capture the progress made in toxicology over the past few years, with more than one-third of the chapters authored by scientists who have not made previous contributions to the book.
  • All-in-One Resource: This text is an up-to-date, all-in-one overview of the biomedical and environmental aspects of toxicology, presented in full color.

products.title: Canine and Feline Anesthesia and Co-Existing Disease 2nd Edition
products.body_html:
Canine and Feline Anesthesia and Co-Existing Disease, 2nd Edition

This book is the only text solely dedicated to practical anesthetic techniques for dogs and cats with co-existing disease. This revised Second Edition expands and updates the content, providing in-depth and clinically-useful information that can easily be incorporated into a progressive companion animal practice. Intuitively organized by body system, this is a must-have, one-stop resource for anesthetic techniques in veterinary patients with co-existing disease and/or altered physiology.

Key Features

  • Concise and Comprehensive: Presents concise, yet comprehensive anesthetic considerations and management plans for dogs and cats with co-existing disease and patients with altered physiology.
  • New Chapters: This edition adds four new chapters focusing on urogenital concerns, genetic diseases, nociceptive disorders, and cardiopulmonary resuscitation and post-resuscitation care.
  • Body System Focus: Explores commonly-encountered disease processes and their anesthetic management, including cardiovascular, respiratory, renal, neurologic, endocrine, and hepatic diseases.
  • Special Populations: Highlights important physiologic alterations encountered in neonatal, pregnant, and geriatric patients and their implications for anesthetic management.
  • Enhanced Visuals: Includes more than 200 new images in full color, new discussions of cutting-edge drugs and techniques, and updated chapters and information throughout.
  • Digital Resources: Includes access to a companion website with relevant clinical videos to enhance learning.
  • Broad Audience: An essential reference for veterinarians, veterinary technicians, and veterinary students.

products.title: BSAVA Manual of Practical Veterinary Welfare (BSAVA British Small Animal Veterinary Association)
products.body_html:
Your Practical Guide to Animal Welfare and Mental Health

This brand new manual provides concise practical information on how to assess and maintain the highest standards of welfare in all veterinary environments. It takes a holistic approach to animal health and covers the welfare of the veterinary team and the positive aspects of the human-animal bond.

Key Features

  • Holistic Approach: The manual covers the welfare of the veterinary team and the "One Health" positive aspects of pet ownership and animal contact, emphasizing a holistic approach to animal health.
  • Practical Information: It provides concise practical information on how to assess and maintain the highest standards of welfare in all veterinary environments.
  • Expert Authorship: Written by a team of experts from a range of disciplines, the manual ensures authoritative and diverse perspectives on welfare science.
  • Broad Audience: This title is relevant to all veterinary professionals and animal carers, as well as those studying animal welfare and behavior.
  • Growing Awareness: It addresses the growing awareness of animal sentience and welfare in parallel with that of human mental health.

products.title: Bovine Pathology: A Text and Color Atlas 1st Edition
products.body_html:
Bovine Pathology: A Text and Color Atlas

This book is a comprehensive single resource to identifying diseases in dairy cattle, feedlot cattle, and their calves. With over 1,000 color images of the highest quality, it correlates clinical information with pathology and differential diagnoses, providing a thorough understanding of bovine diseases from macroscopic appearance to immunohistochemistry.

Key Features

  • Extensive Visuals: Over 1,000 superb color images illustrate the pathologies, making it an invaluable visual reference.
  • Comprehensive Review: It provides a thorough review of mainly Western Hemisphere diseases of cattle, covering macroscopic appearance, microscopic pathology, and immunohistochemistry.
  • Organized for Quick Reference: The book is organized by major organ system, with a synoptic layout, fact sheets, summary boxes, and key bullet points to support its use as a field guide or revision aid.
  • Calf-Hood Diseases: A unique chapter covers calf-hood diseases, addressing conditions specific to young cattle.
  • Clinical Correlation: The text correlates clinical information with pathology and differential diagnoses.
  • Broad Audience: It serves as an essential reference work for veterinary pathologists, residents, students, and bovine practitioners who need to investigate sudden death losses of cattle on the farm.
  • Digital Access: An integrated E-book is included, enhancing its utility as a quick reference.

products.title: Bone surgery in small animals
products.body_html:
Your Practical Manual for Canine Fracture Osteosynthesis

This book is a traumatology manual that describes the most common fractures in the canine species and the way to solve them by osteosynthesis. The first six chapters are devoted to the general aspects of bone growth and healing, fracture classification, and the different types of osseous healing, providing a strong foundation for the surgical treatment of canine trauma.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Coverage: The book covers fractures that can occur in the different bones, from the skull to the phalanges, with the various alternatives to address them and the advantages or disadvantages of the different applicable osteosynthesis systems.
  • Fundamental Principles: The initial chapters provide in-depth information on bone growth and healing, the classification of bone fractures, and the different types of osseous healing.
  • Visual Guidance: The information is supplemented by abundant radiographs showing the reader the possible treatment options for each fracture.
  • Clinical Cases: The author includes a final chapter of selected clinical cases to provide practical, real-world context for the surgical techniques discussed.
  • Practical Focus: This manual is designed to equip veterinary professionals with the knowledge to solve common canine fractures by osteosynthesis.

products.title: Basic Monitoring in Canine and Feline Emergency Patients
products.body_html:
Your Practical Guide to Monitoring Emergency Patients

This book discusses basic monitoring techniques that can be easily performed on emergency canine and feline patients in both first-line emergency and primary care clinics. It provides a succinct approach to understanding the monitoring equipment used in emergency patients, and is an important resource for both veterinary practitioners and students.

Key Features

  • Monitoring Techniques: Techniques include blood pressure measurement, capnography, electrocardiography, pulse oximetry, and point-of-care monitoring.
  • Comprehensive Coverage: The book reviews the physiology, how the equipment works, pros and cons of the equipment, and limitations of the device.
  • Practical Application: A final section in each chapter gives practical examples of how to use the monitoring technique in a clinical setting.
  • Physiology Link: It emphasizes how physiology ties into what information each technique does (and does not) provide.
  • Interpretation: It delivers guidelines for rational interpretation of the results acquired.
  • Visual Learning: The book includes pictures, tables, and diagrams to help explain concepts.
  • Simple Layout: A simple, consistent layout for each chapter makes it easy to quickly locate information within the book.

products.title: Aughey and Frye’s Comparative Veterinary Histology with Clinical Correlates 2nd Edition
products.body_html:
Your Comprehensive Guide to Veterinary Histology

This highly illustrated textbook is a valuable guide to the normal histological appearance of tissues in a wide range of animals, from domestic to exotic species. This new edition is meticulously organized by body system and provides relevant clinical correlates, emphasizing the need to appreciate the normal in order to recognize the abnormal.

Key Features

  • Expanded Species Coverage: This updated edition introduces new species into each chapter, including companion mammals, aquatic species, and livestock, alongside existing coverage of dogs, cats, horses, birds, reptiles, amphibians, and fish.
  • New Chapters and Techniques: A new chapter covers epithelial tissue, and new techniques used in histology and histopathology, such as in situ hybridisation (ISH) and digital image analysis, are discussed throughout.
  • Pathology Integration: Pathogenesis explanations are introduced in the current and many new cases of histopathology, integrating the normal with the abnormal.
  • Expert Authorship: This update is written by two experienced veterinary pathologists and histology lecturers, ensuring the content is both authoritative and practical.
  • Broad Audience: The book is a reference of lasting value for veterinary students, practitioners, and pathologists requiring a quick refresher.

products.title: Atlas of Veterinary Surgical Pathology
products.body_html:
Atlas of Veterinary Surgical Pathology: Your Next-to-the-Microscope Resource

This book is an indispensable, comprehensive exploration of the lesions and diseases most commonly encountered by veterinary pathologists and residents in small animals and horses. It provides an authoritative guide to quickly and accurately identifying common and uncommon lesions, with fully detailed discussions of degenerative, inflammatory, and neoplastic lesions.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Lesion Coverage: The book includes detailed coverage of diseases of the skin, eye, and musculoskeletal systems, as well as the male and female reproductive tracts.
  • Microscopic Detail: It offers descriptions of relevant microscopic features and features more than 500 color microphotographs of the included lesions.
  • Surgical Pathology Techniques: The book provides a thorough introduction to the techniques relevant to surgical pathology, including specimen preparation and the interpretation of biopsy and the reporting of results.
  • Organized Content: It includes comprehensive explorations of skin and adjacent soft tissue and complete treatments of lesions of the musculoskeletal system, and eye and periocular tissues.
  • Broad Audience: Perfect for veterinary pathologists and residents, this book is a practical handbook for the lesions and diseases encountered in small animal and equine surgical pathology.

products.title: Atlas of Comparative Diagnostic and Experimental Hematology 2nd Edition
products.body_html:
Your Guide to Laboratory Animal Hematology and Morphology

This book is a vital, fully revised new edition and an essential reference for clinical pathologists in diagnostic and research laboratories. The atlas contains over 400 color images of cells from the peripheral blood and bone marrow from a variety of animals encountered in laboratory animal medicine, in health and disease.

Key Features

  • New Flow Cytometry Chapter: Includes a new chapter on flow cytometry and its application in routine analyses, which is of particular relevance for pre-clinical safety assessment.
  • Latest Developments: Covers the most recent developments in laboratory animal hematology, including parameters measured by the latest generation of analyzers.
  • Comprehensive Visuals: Photomicrographs present normal and abnormal blood cells from a variety of hematological conditions along with descriptive text.
  • Broad Species Coverage: Covers a wide range of laboratory animal species, as well as those used in clinical veterinary trials.
  • Research Relevance: This book is an essential reference for medical or veterinary research and diagnostic laboratories.

products.title: Athymic Nude Rat Brain Atlas 1st Edition
products.body_html:
Your Definitive Stereotaxic Atlas of the Athymic Nude Rat Brain

This book is the first stereotaxic brain atlas of the athymic nude rat, a T-cell deficient model commonly used in experimental and pre-clinical studies. This 2D vector-based atlas contains coronal, sagittal, and horizontal brain sections rendered from a single cleared specimen, enabling readers to better calculate coordinates for precise injections using stereotaxic surgery.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Maps: Contains coronal, sagittal, and horizontal maps of the young adult athymic nude rat brain, spaced with a distance of 0.2 or 0.25 mm.
  • Precision Targeting: The maps allow for the easy read-out of coordinates for precise injections using stereotaxic surgery to target specific structures for toxin, virus, or cell delivery.
  • Standardized Landmarks: Uses "flat skull" Bregma and Lambda as anatomical landmarks for correct placement in the 3D environment.
  • Specialized Content: Includes a map of the dopamine projection system as well as the distribution of the A8-A14 dopamine cell groups.
  • Authoritative Nomenclature: Anatomical structures and nomenclature follow the standard set by the Paxinos and Watson rat brain atlases.
  • Target Audience: A valuable resource for any neuroscientist who wishes to work with nude rats in experimental and pre-clinical studies.

products.title: Asking Animals: An Introduction to Animal Behaviour Testing
products.body_html:
Your Practical Guide to Animal Behaviour Tests

This contemporary, thought-provoking yet utterly practical book provides an introductory text covering the use and misuse of behaviour tests applied to animals. By including illustrative examples from a variety of species, this book inspires the animal scientist to think about what a given behavioral test can be used for and how the results can be interpreted.

Key Features

  • Practical Guidance: The text includes the dos and don'ts of running behaviour tests and interpreting the results, offering practical, evidence-based advice for immediate application.
  • Comprehensive Coverage: It provides information on behavior tests for a whole range of species, including companion, farm, zoo, laboratory, and wild animals.
  • Accessible Format: Featuring many clear, simple illustrations, the information is made readily accessible and the succinct text is designed to be read cover to cover and stimulate further reading.
  • Research Toolkit: This book is an essential item in the researcher's toolkit when embarking on and devising any animal behaviour test.
