  • Broad Audience: It is valuable to students, established researchers, teachers, and practitioners of applied ethology, animal welfare science, and veterinary science.

products.title: Animal Physiotherapy: Assessment, Treatment and Rehabilitation of Animals 2nd Edition
products.body_html:
Your Essential Guide to Veterinary Physiotherapy 

This book is a thoroughly updated edition of an essential reference guide for physiotherapists and physical therapists looking to apply the proven benefits of physiotherapy to the treatment of companion and performance animals.

Key Features

  • Expanded Coverage: Seven new chapters provide greatly expanded coverage of practical treatment and rehabilitation techniques.
  • Evidence-Based Review: Includes reviews of different physiotherapy techniques, drawing on both human and animal literature for a comprehensive, evidence-based foundation.
  • Clinical Application: Discusses treatment approaches in small animal medicine as well as for elite equine athletes.
  • Clinical Reasoning Model: Provides an applied evidence-based clinical reasoning model, supported by numerous case examples.
  • Visual Learning: The book is now in full color with many more illustrations, enhancing comprehension and practical application.

products.title: Animal Nutrition Paperback
products.body_html:
Your Comprehensive Guide to Animal Nutrition

This book is a thoroughly updated new edition of a classic, market-leading text, providing a clear and comprehensive introduction to the science and practice of animal nutrition. It is a trusted resource supported by key experimental evidence throughout, covering modern advancements in animal food nourishment, composition of foods, and feeding standards for a vast array of domestic species.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Structure: The book is split into six main sections, covering The components of food; The digestion and metabolism of nutrients; Quantifying the nutrient content of digestibility, energy, and protein values; The nutrient requirements of animals; The nutritional characteristics of foods; and Animal products and human nutrition.
  • Expanded Species Coverage: It covers feeding standards for dairy and beef cattle, sheep, pigs and poultry, horses, and has expanded coverage for cats and dogs.
  • Modern Topics: New sections include nutritional topics related to molecular biology, the environment, and the usage of novel foods such as insects for animal feeding.
  • Quantitative Learning: Quantitative aspects of the subject are clearly explained and illustrated by worked examples. Problems have been added to all chapters, and the appendices include solutions to all chapter-end numeric questions.
  • Study Aids: Chapter-end summaries and questions allow students to recap and test their knowledge of the chapter topic.
  • Broad Audience: This text is an essential resource for undergraduates studying Animal Science, Veterinary Science, Agriculture, Biology, and Biochemistry.

products.title: Animal Ethics in the Wild: Wild Animal Suffering and Intervention in Nature
products.body_html:
Intervening in Nature: A Call to Action for Wild Animal Suffering

This book confronts the ethical and practical issue of wild animal suffering, arguing that most wild animals likely endure short lives full of suffering, often ending in terrible deaths due to natural causes. It challenges the traditional view of non-intervention, proposing that humans have a moral reason to assist these animals.

Key Features

  • Ethical Intervention: The book argues that on the assumption that we have reasons to assist others in need, we should intervene in nature to prevent or reduce the harms wild animals suffer, provided that it is feasible and the expected result is positive overall.
  • A Call for Action: It stresses the importance of academics from different disciplines and animal advocates beginning to confront this issue, stating that increased concern will make it more probable that safe and effective solutions will be implemented in the future.
  • Core Problem: It highlights the reality that wild animals are highly exposed to, and have a low capacity to cope with, harmful natural processes, resulting in lives "full of suffering, usually ending in terrible deaths."
  • Broad Audience: This is an essential read for academics from different disciplines as well as animal advocates who are concerned with the plight of wild animals and the feasibility of implementing solutions.

products.title: Animal Behavior 3rd Edition
products.body_html:
Animal Behavior, 3rd Edition: From Neurology to Conservation

This book provides a comprehensive overview of animal behavior, covering its neurological underpinnings to the importance of behavior in conservation. The book is an essential work for students and academics seeking a foundation in the field, with each chapter beginning with learning objectives and ending with thought-provoking questions.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Coverage: Chapters cover social behavior and the relationship between parasites, pathogens, and behavior. Thoughtful coverage has also been given to foraging behavior, mating and parenting behavior, anti-predator behavior, and learning.
  • Physiological Foundations: It addresses the physiological foundations of behavior in a way that is both accessible and inviting.
  • Updated and Revised: This new edition features updated and revised chapters, with new case studies and high-definition illustrations.
  • New Focuses: The book highlights new focuses on animal welfare issues and companion animal behavior.
  • Learning Tools: Each chapter begins with learning objectives and ends with thought-provoking questions. Special terms and definitions are highlighted throughout to aid in comprehension.
  • Broad Audience: Provides a rich resource on animal science and behavior for students and professors from a wide range of life science disciplines.

products.title: Animal Assisted Therapy Use Application by Condition 1st Edition
products.body_html:
Your Comprehensive Guide to Animal-Assisted Therapy Applications

This book provides the most updated and comprehensive data knowledge on animal-assisted therapy (AAT). It synthesizes historical information, theory, clinical practice, and data from recent clinical studies on AAT for post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and other diseases. Written by international experts, this resource employs a hypothesis-driven, data-rich approach to inform readers on current research and serves as a vital reference for clinical practice.

Key Features

  • Essential Information: Includes essential information on animal-assisted therapy for clinicians, researchers, students, and animal training and handling organizations.
  • Mechanisms of Action: Examines PTSD in history, literature, and arts, along with theories of the mechanism of clinical action of animal-assisted therapy.
  • War Combat Veterans: Features unique contributions by war combat veterans who use animal-assisted therapy for the treatment of PTSD.
  • Multidisciplinary Authorship: Contributions are drawn from international experts in medicine, clinical psychology and therapy, speech therapy, clinical research, and animal training and welfare.
  • Data-Driven Approach: The book uses a hypothesis-driven, data-rich approach to inform readers on current research and serve as a reference for clinical practice.

products.title: Animal Abuse and Interpersonal Violence: A Psycho-Criminological Understanding (Psycho-Criminology of Crime, Mental Health, and the Law)
products.body_html:
A Comprehensive Guide to Animal Abuse & Interpersonal Violence

This book is an authoritative volume that provides a comprehensive examination of the many aspects of the link between animal cruelty and human violence. Presenting new theory, research, policy, and practice, this book explores the subject through a psycho-criminological lens to describe, explain, and potentially prevent intentional behavior that causes pain, suffering, or death in animals and humans.

Key Features

  • Integrated Approach: It offers up-to-date research and provides real-world insights into current thinking in the study of animal abuse and interpersonal violence, using an integrated theoretical-practical approach.

  • Central Topics: Sixteen in-depth chapters examine central topics in the field, including different forms of animal exploitation, connections between animal cruelty and substance abuse, and the association between childhood animal cruelty and adult interpersonal violence.

  • Clinical and Legal Roles: It explores the role of veterinarians in the identification of animal abuse cases and the complex legal aspects of animal abuse cases.

  • Defining Maltreatment: It defines and describes various types of animal maltreatment and their links to different forms of interpersonal violence.

  • Broad Audience: This book is essential reading for practitioners, researchers, scholars, and advanced students in fields such as behavioral science, law, criminology, veterinary forensics, criminal justice, social work, and animal welfare.

products.title: An Introduction to Animal Behaviour 6th Edition
products.body_html:
An Introduction to Animal Behavior: Your Guide to the Fundamentals

This book is a beautifully written, revised, and updated edition of a classic text that provides an introduction to the fundamentals of animal behavior. It offers clear explanations, concise and readable text, and is filled with fascinating examples of complex behavioral mechanisms.

Key Features

  • Fundamental Framework: The text is structured around Tinbergen's four questions of causation, evolution, development, and function, providing a strong academic foundation.
  • Comprehensive Scope: The book provides accounts of all levels of behavior, from the nerve cell to that of the population.
  • Fascinating Examples: Concepts are illustrated with fascinating examples of complex behavioral mechanisms, such as wolves greeting each other and the specialized foraging behavior of a bumble bee.
  • Enhanced Visuals: Now in full color, this revised and updated edition features numerous illustrations to enhance understanding.
  • Broad Audience: The book is an excellent resource for students seeking a clear, concise, and enthusiastic introduction to the subject.

products.title: Advances in animal science and zoology
products.body_html:
The Central Role of Domesticated Animals

This volume provides an overview of the profound importance of animals to human existence, culture, and civilization, exploring the fields of Animal Science and Zoology. Animals are central to our daily lives, serving uses across disciplines such as sports, entertainment, manufacturing, companionship, and scientific research, in addition to providing food.

Key Concepts

  • Foundation of Civilization: Many scholars believe that the domestication of animals was the catalyst for human civilization. The shift to a more sedentary lifestyle, enabled by a secure supply of food and clothing from livestock, led to a rise in population and the subdivision of labor within communities.
  • Animal Science & Zoology: Animal Science focuses on the biological science and management of livestock (including cattle, horses, sheep, pigs, and fowl), which are vital to our livelihood. Zoology is the broader scientific research of the structure, physiology, classification, distribution, and behavior of all animals.
  • Livestock and Culture: Agriculture and its livestock have become a key aspect of our culture, influencing our impact on the environment and shaping the direct or indirect effects of our daily activities.
  • Definition of Domesticated Animals: This volume introduces domesticated animals as those that are useful in the home and are easily raised and cared for by humans. Common examples include horses, cattle, dogs, sheep, buffaloes, and poultry.

Target Audience: Students, researchers, and general readers interested in animal science, zoology, agricultural history, and the human-animal bond.

products.title: Adams and Stashak's Lameness in Horses 7th Edition
products.body_html:
Your Gold-Standard Guide to Equine Lameness, 7th Edition

This book provides a fully updated Seventh Edition of the classic gold-standard reference on equine lameness. With contributions from the world’s leading authorities, this book features more in-depth information on objective lameness assessment, sports medicine, rehabilitation, treatment options, and advanced imaging.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Coverage: The book covers functional anatomy, examination, imaging, lameness of the distal limb, proximal limb, and axial skeleton, principles of musculoskeletal disease, therapies, occupation-related conditions, lameness in young horses, and farriery.
  • Updated Expertise: It includes more extensive information on objective lameness assessment, sports medicine, rehabilitation, treatment options, and advanced imaging.
  • Extensive Visuals: It features over 1,700 images to illustrate the concepts described, making it an exhaustive reference for all aspects of lameness in horses.
  • Expert Authorship: Written by internationally renowned experts in the field, this is the definitive resource on equine lameness.
  • Companion Website: The book is supplemented with a companion website offering a plethora of "how-to" videos demonstrating physical examination techniques, including palpation, hoof testing, flexion tests, and perineural and intrasynovial injection techniques.
  • Broad Audience: A must-have reference for any practicing large animal and equine veterinarian, equine veterinary specialist, or veterinary student dealing with lameness in the horse.

products.title: 3D joint anatomy in dogs: Main joint pathologies and surgical approaches + Integreated 3D videos
products.body_html:
Your Visual Guide to Canine Limb Joint Anatomy and Surgery

This book is a visual guide with a strongly educational approach covering the main joints in the limbs of the dog. It provides a unique and practical resource by showing the anatomical elements of each joint in three-dimensional diagrams.

Key Features

  • 3D Anatomical Diagrams: It shows the anatomical elements of each joint in three-dimensional diagrams, which are crucial for spatial understanding.
  • Surgical Focus: The views chosen for each case have been selected for a practical purpose, showing the position of the elements involved in the most commonly used surgical approaches.
  • Orthopaedic Conditions: The book describes the key orthopaedic conditions affecting each joint and the most commonly used surgical approaches.
  • Multimodal Visuals: It contains a large number of images and illustrations, along with a selection of digital video views, to enhance the learning experience.
  • Broad Audience: This book is an essential resource for veterinary students, surgeons, and practitioners interested in canine orthopedics.

products.title: Zuku prep - Master the Entire Scope of Veterinary Medicine (Bonus)
products.body_html:
Zuku's expert-designed, visual courses are more than just study tools—they're your complete roadmap to becoming a confident, knowledgeable veterinary professional.

Trusted by more than 80,000 veterinary colleagues worldwide, Zuku helps you build real mastery of core concepts, crush uncertainty, and walk into any clinical scenario feeling unstoppable.

Comprehensive Study Materials

Zuku provides a wealth of organized content, including a robust Question Bank and detailed FlashCards, ensuring you cover every topic and species essential for your deep understanding and application of veterinary medicine.

products.title: Advances in poultry genetics and genomics (Burleigh Dodds Series in Agricultural Science (79)) Illustrated Edition
products.body_html:
A Comprehensive Review of Recent Developments in Poultry Breeding

This book provides a comprehensive review of recent developments in poultry breeding. It begins by reviewing the current challenges facing poultry breeding, such as genetic diversity and physiological constraints. It then goes on to review recent research on the genetics of key traits and their implications for breeding.

Key Features

  • Current Challenges: The book begins by reviewing the current challenges facing poultry breeding, such as genetic diversity and physiological constraints.
  • Genetics of Key Traits: It reviews recent research on the genetics of key traits, from production traits such as egg production to functional traits such as bone strength, and their implications for breeding.
  • Genomic Selection: The book then summarises key advances in genomic selection techniques and their application in broiler and layer breeding.
  • Emerging Trends: It concludes by surveying emerging trends, such as the use of epigenetics and genome editing in poultry breeding.
  • Comprehensive Review: This collection provides a comprehensive review of recent developments in poultry breeding.

products.title: Volume 3 - Achieving sustainable production of poultry meat Volume 3: Health and welfare (Burleigh Dodds Series in Agricultural Science, 15) Illustrated Edition
products.body_html:
Achieving Sustainable Poultry Production: Health and Welfare, Volume 3

This book reviews research on poultry health and welfare, directly addressing the challenges of managing increased disease risk and meeting high consumer demands for quality, sustainability, and animal welfare in intensive production systems. This is a standard reference for poultry and food scientists globally.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Health Review: Part 1 reviews the range of diseases and other health issues affecting poultry. It then discusses ways of preventing and managing disease, such as breeding, and means of attenuating the immune system.
  • Welfare and Management: Part 2 discusses welfare issues, covering the management of breeding flocks, housing, transport, and humane slaughter techniques.
  • Sustainability Context: The book addresses the increased risk of disease transmission and zoonoses associated with more intensive production systems, linking health and welfare directly to the goal of sustainable production.
  • Volume Series: This volume is the third in a series, complementing two further volumes which review safety, quality, sustainability, and poultry breeding and nutrition.
  • Broad Audience: It will be a standard reference for poultry and food scientists in universities, government, research centers, and companies involved in poultry production.

products.title: Volume 2 - Achieving sustainable production of poultry meat: Breeding and nutrition (Burleigh Dodds Series in Agricultural Science, 14)
products.body_html:
Achieving Sustainable Poultry Production: Breeding and Nutrition, Volume 2

This book provides a comprehensive overview of research on poultry breeding and nutrition, directly addressing the challenge of meeting growing global demand for poultry meat. It is a standard reference that helps producers optimize output while managing the increased risks associated with intensive systems and meeting high consumer demands for quality and sustainability.

Key Features

  • Genetic Advancements: Part 1 of the book reviews how advances in genetics have impacted developments in poultry breeding, providing the latest research in this field.
  • Optimized Nutrition: Part 2 discusses ways of optimising poultry nutrition to ensure quality and sustainability in poultry meat production.
  • Feed Formulation and Safety: Chapters review the use of feedstuffs and ingredients such as amino acids, enzymes, and probiotics, as well as essential topics like feed formulation and safety.
  • Sustainability Focus: The book addresses key modern concerns, including the environmental impact of poultry production and animal welfare within intensive production systems.
  • Volume Series: This volume is a standard reference that is accompanied by two further volumes, which review safety, quality, and sustainability, as well as poultry health and welfare.
  • Broad Audience: It will be a standard reference for poultry and food scientists in universities, government and research centers, and companies involved in poultry production.

products.title: Volume 1 - Achieving sustainable production of poultry meat Volume 1: Safety, quality and sustainability (Burleigh Dodds Series in Agricultural Science, 13)
products.body_html:
Achieving Sustainable Poultry Production: Safety, Quality, and Sustainability

This book provides a valuable account of modern food safety management in poultry processing, coupled with the key elements of sustainable production systems. As world poultry production faces the challenge of meeting growing global demand, this book draws on an international range of expertise to review research on safety, quality, and sustainability issues in poultry production.

Key Features

  • Risk Management: Part 1 of the book discusses risks from pathogens, detection, and safety management on farms and in slaughterhouse operations, addressing the increased risk of rapid disease transmission in intensive systems.
  • Product Quality: Part 2 looks at ways of enhancing the flavor, color, texture, and nutritional quality of poultry meat to meet high consumer expectations.
  • Sustainability Issues: The book addresses key modern concerns, reviewing the environmental impact of poultry production and animal welfare issues.
  • Comprehensive Resource: This is the first of three volumes, making it a standard reference for poultry and food scientists in universities, government, and research centers.
  • Broad Audience: It is an essential resource for companies involved in poultry production and addresses issues of animal welfare and the complexity of supply chains.

products.title: [March 31, 2025] Veterinary Nursing of Exotic Pets and Wildlife 3rd Edition
products.body_html:
Veterinary Nursing of Exotic Pets and Wildlife, 3rd Edition

This book is a revised and expanded update of the essential text for veterinary nurses caring for exotic pets and wildlife species. Organized into logical sections, it is the gold standard in the field, providing comprehensive coverage of anatomy, physiology, husbandry, diseases, and critical care medicine for a wide variety of exotic species.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Species Coverage: It covers the anatomy and physiology, housing, husbandry, handling, and nutrition of a wide variety of exotic species. This includes common exotic pets such as rabbits, rodents, hedgehogs, lizards, snakes, tortoises, and cage birds.
  • New Wildlife Section: The book features an entirely new section on wildlife species, including chemical restraints, therapeutics, and rehabilitation for Eurasian wildlife species.
  • Evidence-Based Practice: It maintains a strong focus on evidence-based care practice and the latest guidance for veterinary nursing.
  • Practical Learning Tools: The book includes appendices with nursing care plans for exotic pets and wildlife, featuring filled-out example cases.
  • Core Curriculum Alignment: The content includes everything you need to succeed as a veterinary nurse studying for the RCVS nursing syllabus, as well as postgraduate and advanced programs.
  • Clinical Disciplines: The text covers diseases, therapeutics, diagnostic imaging, and critical care medicine of a wide variety of exotic species.

products.title: 100 Top Consultations in Small Animal General Practice 1st Edition
products.body_html:
Your Trusted Companion for Small Animal Consultations

This book offers essential guidance to the 100 most common problems encountered in small animal general practice, focusing on "day one competencies." Organized by presenting sign or disease and featuring color illustrations throughout, this book is like having an experienced clinician standing by your side in the consulting room. It is ideal for the undergraduate, newly qualified vet, or anyone seeking an up-to-date refresher.

Key Features

  • Competency Focused: Focusing on "day one competencies", the book addresses 100 core scenarios commonly seen in small animal practice.
  • Practical Guidance: Each chapter explains how to make a diagnosis and which interventions are most appropriate in general practice.
  • Client Communication: The book provides essential advice on what the vet should say to the client before and after the examination.
  • Tackling Tough Questions: The authors tackle the tough questions: What if it doesn't get better? What is the low-cost option? When should I refer?
  • Comprehensive Topics: The book offers invaluable advice on other key topics such as annual health checks, neutering, and euthanasia.
  • Organized Format: Organized by presenting sign (diarrhoea, itching) or disease (diabetes mellitus, pancreatitis), the book is easy to navigate for quick reference.
  • Broad Audience: Never before has so much practical information been brought together in a single volume, making it a trusted companion for students and practitioners alike.

products.title: Veterinary Immunology 11th Edition
products.body_html:
Veterinary Immunology, 11th Edition: Your Complete Immunologic Resource

This book is the only complete resource on immunology for veterinary practitioners, exploring the immunologic concerns of both large and small animals. Selected as a Doody’s Core Titles® 2024, this new edition has been meticulously updated to continue its trend of incorporating the latest advances and topics in the field, featuring a straightforward presentation of basic immunologic principles along with thorough and timely information on the most significant immunologic diseases and responses seen in domestic animals.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Coverage: It clearly explains the general principles of immunology and provides information on the most significant immunologic diseases and immunologic responses seen in domestic animals.
  • Cutting-Edge Content: The completely updated content covers the latest advances and topics in veterinary immunology, including cutting-edge information on drugs for the immune system, antibodies, vaccines, and cancer immunology.
  • Clinical Relevance: A wealth of clinical examples show how immunologic principles are applied in the clinical setting, making complex topics easier to understand for professional practice.
  • Enhanced eBook: The enhanced eBook version, included with every new print purchase, features flashcards and enhanced animations, plus access to all the text, figures, and references, with the ability to search, customize content, and make notes.
  • Target Audience: This is the only complete resource on immunology for veterinary practitioners, and is ideal for students and experienced clinicians.

products.title: VTNE Study Guide 2025-2026: Achieving Veterinary Excellence | Comprehensive Strategies, Practice Tests, Q&A, Exclusive Content and Insights for the VTNE
products.body_html:
Dominate the VTNE: Your Comprehensive Path to Veterinary Excellence

This comprehensive resource is meticulously crafted to help you conquer the Veterinary Technician National Exam (VTNE) and achieve your career goals with confidence. The "VTNE STUDY GUIDE" provides clarity on the exam structure and requirements, along with expert strategies to help you register for the exam and prepare efficiently.

Key Features

  • Thorough Exam Understanding: Gain clarity on the VTNE exam structure and requirements to kickstart your preparation effectively.
  • Professional Insight: Explore the essential responsibilities and roles of veterinary technicians to align your career aspirations.
  • Foundational Mastery: Comprehensive coverage of Veterinary Anatomy, Physiology, and Pathology helps you master the foundational knowledge necessary for veterinary practice.
  • Crucial Clinical Subjects: In-depth study of Pharmacology, Surgical Nursing, and Anesthesia enhances your essential clinical skills.
  • Diagnostic & Lab Skills: Detailed exploration of Diagnostic Imaging and Laboratory Procedures equips you with essential techniques for accurate testing.
  • Specialized Topics: Includes exclusive content on Dentistry, Animal Behavior, and Practice Management—subjects crucial for veterinary practice success.
  • Expert Strategies: Learn proven techniques to register for the exam and prepare efficiently.

products.title: Optimum Vitamin Nutrition for More Sustainable Ruminant Farming
products.body_html:
Optimizing Vitamin Nutrition for Sustainable Ruminant Farming

This book provides concise, up-to-date information on vitamin nutrition for ruminants. As animal protein production is ever evolving, optimizing vitamin nutrition is a valuable tool enabling a more sustainable beef and dairy production by enhancing animal welfare, robustness, performance, and reducing food waste.

Key Features

  • Sustainable Farming: It provides concise, up-to-date information on vitamin nutrition for ruminants, specifically aimed at improving animal welfare, robustness, and performance, and reducing food waste.
  • Research-Based Information: This book is a reference for research and extension specialists who need the most current, research-based information on vitamins in ruminants.
  • Focus on Sustainability: It explores the role of vitamin nutrition in driving increasing standards in animal health and welfare, sustainability, and food quality.
  • Part of a Series: This book is the fourth of a series of books covering optimum vitamin nutrition in poultry, swine, and aquaculture.

products.title: An Introduction to Ethorobotics: Robotics and the Study of Animal Behaviour 1st Edition
products.body_html:
Ethorobotics: The Intersection of Animal Behavior and Robotics

This pioneering text explores the emerging discipline of ethorobotics, which brings together the fields of animal behavior and robotics. It encourages closer collaboration between behavioral scientists and engineers to facilitate the creation of robots with a higher degree of functionality in animal/human environments and to broaden the understanding of animal behavior in new and intriguing ways.

Key Features

  • Interdisciplinary Introduction: The book is divided into two introductory parts: The first part offers an accessible introduction to the biology of animal behavior for engineers, covering topics like social cognition and communication. The second part introduces the basic construction of robots for non-engineers, including technical achievements and current limitations.
  • Core Framework: The third part explores the core theme of ethorobotics, its evolution, and current topics, including ethical considerations, autonomy, and 'living' social robots.
  • Practical Applications: The final chapter looks at ethorobotics in practice through key research projects which have had the biggest impact.
  • Groundbreaking Text: This is a ground-breaking interdisciplinary text that utilizes the knowledge of key ethologists and roboticists in the field today.
  • Broad Audience: It will appeal to upper-level undergraduates, postgraduates, and researchers focusing on animal behavior and cognition, as well as those undertaking courses in engineering, social robotics, biologically inspired robotics, AI, and human–robot and animal–robot interactions.

products.title: King's Applied Anatomy of the Central Nervous System of Domestic Mammals 2nd Edition
products.body_html:
Your Essential Guide to Veterinary Neurology and Neuroanatomy, 2nd Edition

This book is an ideal introduction for those with no prior knowledge of the central nervous system, presented in a logical and accessible manner. By blending descriptive anatomy with clinical neurology, this updated second edition unlocks the mystery of veterinary neurology and offers a unique approach that explains the structure and function of the central nervous system while highlighting the relevance to clinical practice.

Key Features

  • Unique Approach: The text offers a unique approach by blending descriptive anatomy with clinical neurology, explaining how the central nervous system is constructed, works, and how to recognize damaged components.
  • Updated Clinical Content: This second edition is revised and updated to cover the latest clinical developments, including additional content on electrodiagnostic methods, stem cell transplantation, and advanced imaging.
  • Learning Tools: The book comes with a companion website featuring self-assessment questions, label the diagram exercises, and downloadable figures to aid further learning.
  • Broad Audience: An excellent introductory text for veterinary students, it is also an invaluable reference for trainee veterinary neurology specialists and veterinary practitioners with a particular interest in neurology.

products.title: Cunningham's Textbook of Veterinary Physiology 6th Edition
products.body_html:
Your Definitive Guide to Veterinary Physiology, 6th Edition

This book approaches the vast subject of veterinary physiology in a practical, user-friendly way that helps you grasp key concepts and learn how they relate to clinical practice. You'll gain the solid foundation needed before advancing in the veterinary curriculum, moving systematically from cell physiology to body system function, homeostasis, and immune function.

Key Features

  • Clinical Application: "Clinical Correlations" boxes present case studies that illustrate exactly how to apply physiology principles and concepts to the diagnosis and treatment of veterinary patients.
  • Exam Preparation: "Key Points" at the beginning of each chapter introduce new concepts, and practice questions at the end of each chapter test your understanding and provide valuable review for exams.
  • Enhanced Visuals: The full-color format highlights helpful information and enhances learning with a wealth of illustrations that visually depict specific functions and conditions.
  • Online Resources: Expanded resources on the companion Evolve website include state-of-the-art 3D animations, practice tests, a glossary, and additional clinical correlations.
  • Expert Content: New contributors lend their unique perspective and expertise to ensure the content is current and authoritative.

products.title: Diagnostic Imaging for Veterinary Technicians, 2nd edition
products.body_html:
Your Comprehensive Guide to Veterinary Diagnostic Imaging

This book is a comprehensive diagnostic imaging textbook that includes detailed positioning information for radiographic studies in the small animal clinic. The text showcases a systematic approach to the positioning of feline, canine, equine, and exotic animal patients for routine and special radiographic procedures, including dentistry procedures.

Key Features

  • Systematic Approach: The text showcases a systematic approach to the positioning of feline, canine, equine, and exotic animal patients.
  • Comprehensive Coverage: It provides detailed positioning information for radiographic studies in the small animal clinic, including dentistry procedures.
  • Broad Species Coverage: It covers feline, canine, equine, and exotic animal patients for routine and special radiographic procedures.
  • Target Audience: This book is an essential guide for veterinary technicians and students who want to master diagnostic imaging.
  • Practical Focus: The book is a comprehensive diagnostic imaging textbook with a focus on practical application in the small animal clinic.

products.title: Elsevier's Veterinary Assisting Textbook 4th Edition
products.body_html:
Your Complete Guide to Veterinary Assisting, 4th Edition

This book prepares you for the role and responsibilities of the veterinary assistant. It covers everything you need to know to pass the Approved Veterinary Assistant (AVA) Exam and succeed in clinical practice. NAVTA-approved guidelines help you learn to assist in laboratory and radiographic procedures, properly restrain animals, and manage practice facilities.

Key Features

  • Hospice and Grief Care: A NEW chapter on Hospice, Grief, and Pet Loss discusses the human-animal bond, stages of grief, and the principles of the veterinary assistant’s role in helping owners through pet loss.
  • Fear-Free Techniques: EXPANDED Behavior content includes the latest in handling methods that focus on reducing fear and stress in patients.
  • Comprehensive Coverage: This book provides everything you need to prepare for the AVA certification exam, including setting up equipment, collecting samples, handling and dispensing medications, and record keeping.
  • Step-by-Step Instructions: Step-by-step instructions and hundreds of colorful photographs clearly break down veterinary assisting tasks and clarify essential information.
  • Online Resources: NEW practice quizzes on the companion Evolve website allow you to test your understanding of key concepts.
  • Updated Information: UPDATED drug information covers the newest pharmacologic agents, and updated infection control and vaccination coverage keeps you current with the latest guidelines and protocols.
  • Practice Management: Discussion of office procedures and client relations prepares you for the business aspects of veterinary practice and clarifies your role in relation to the entire veterinary healthcare team.

products.title: Handbook on Animal-Assisted Therapy 6th Edition
products.body_html:
Your Leading Reference for Animal-Assisted Therapy, 6th Edition

This book continues to be the leading textbook and reference in the field of animal-assisted therapy (AAT) for clinical practitioners. This new, fully updated edition provides the evidence basis for the effectiveness of this treatment, as well as clear guidelines on how to perform it—from the selection of the therapy animal to application with patients.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Structure: Organized into four sections, the book explores the conceptualization of the animal-human bond, best practices for AAI professionals, considerations related to animal selection/training/welfare, and utilizing AAI in special populations.
  • New and Updated Content: Contains 15 new chapters covering culture, research, standards of practice, and more, ensuring the information is current and comprehensive.
  • Practical Guidance: It guides readers on how to work with a therapy animal safely and effectively.
  • Targeted Applications: The book covers AAT with special populations and for specific disorders.
  • Certification Support: It summarizes current research on AAT and supports study for the Animal-Assisted Intervention Specialist Certification Exam.

products.title: Practical Handbook of Veterinary Physiology
products.body_html:
Your Guide to Foundational Veterinary Physiology

This book provides a strong foundation for veterinary graduate students, covering practical aspects of veterinary physiology that are crucial for understanding pathophysiology, animal productivity, and treatment strategies. Written in simple language, it helps undergraduate students better understand the basic principles of physiology that pertain to the health of domestic animals and birds.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Systems Coverage: The book covers practical aspects of the circulatory, digestive, respiratory, excretory, endocrine, and reproductive systems.
  • Broad Topics: It also includes coverage of animal behavior and environmental physiology.
  • Practical Reference: The text includes physiological reference values and interpretation to help with practical application.
  • Accessible Language: Written in simple language, this book ensures that undergraduate students can easily grasp basic physiological principles.
  • Core Foundation: This knowledge is crucial for understanding pathophysiology, animal productivity, and treatment strategies.

products.title: [December 31, 2024] The Busy Vet's Guide to Cytology: What Do All the Blobs Mean?
products.body_html:
Your Indispensable Guide to Veterinary Cytology in Practice

This book is an indispensable, in-practice guide to using cytology in everyday veterinary practice. It outlines the basics of cytological examination and explores how to work with cytology results as a diagnostic tool alongside other treatments and assessments. The book is accessible and digestible, designed to be an aid to busy vets in practice.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Techniques: It covers acquiring and preparing cytological specimens, staining slides, and microscope use.
  • Body System Approach: The book addresses general principles of veterinary cytology and then takes a body-system approach applied to all veterinary patients.
  • Diagnostic Integration: It explores how to work with cytology results as a diagnostic tool alongside other treatments and assessments.
  • Case Resolution: The guide includes working with labs, a round-up of difficult cases, and digital cytology.
  • Interpretation: It focuses on interpreting samples from common locations to provide clear and actionable results.
  • Broad Audience: This indispensable aid is perfect for vets in practice who need a quick, reliable reference.

products.title: [April 1, 2025] Veterinary Nursing of the Wild, Exotic and Unusual
products.body_html:
Proceedings of the 2023 Exotic Veterinary Nurse Training Conference

This book is a collection of presentations from the 2023 Exotic Veterinary Nurse Training Conference. Our authors are experts from around Australia and the globe, writing about species relevant to veterinary nurses working in general practice or exotic-only veterinary clinics.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Coverage: It covers a wide range of topics, making it a comprehensive resource for veterinary nurses working in exotic animal care.
  • Expert Authorship: The authors are experts from around Australia and the globe, providing a broad and international perspective.
  • Practical Resource: This book is a valuable resource for veterinary nurses working in general practice or exotic-only veterinary clinics.
  • Latest Information: It contains presentations from the 2023 Exotic Veterinary Nurse Training Conference, ensuring the information is current and relevant.
  • Species Relevance: The topics cover species relevant to veterinary nurses working in exotic animal care, making it an essential guide for daily practice.

products.title: [February 27, 2025] The Veterinary General Practice Casebook: Companion Animal Clinics 1st Edition
products.body_html:
The Veterinary General Practice Casebook

This book echoes life at the coalface of companion animal practice, presenting cases as they appear in real life—often messier and less complete than textbook descriptions. Organized into "clinics," each chapter feels like a day in the life of a busy general practitioner, where emergencies are juggled with routine consultations and something unexpected pops up.

Key Features

  • Real-World Scenarios: Cases are presented as they appear in real life, such as a harmless-looking papilloma on Monday morning or a pyometra last thing on Friday, providing a practical learning experience.
  • Organized by "Clinics": Organized into "clinics," each chapter simulates a day in the life of a busy general practitioner, where emergencies are juggled with routine consultations.
  • Practical Content: The clinical content is complemented by topics on wellbeing and professional practice, as well as recipes for simple and nutritious meals to feed the body and soul.
  • Broad Audience: This book is ideal for senior veterinary students, new graduates, those returning to practice, and those seeking a general practice workout.
  • Specialty Recognition: The book makes a persuasive argument for general practice as a speciality in its own right and celebrates the vital contribution of general practice veterinarians to animal health and welfare.

products.title: Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery in Dogs and Cats 2nd Edition
products.body_html:
Canine Sports Medicine and Rehabilitation, 3rd Edition: Your Comprehensive Clinical Reference

Grounded in the latest scientific literature, this book presents the state of the art in sports medicine and rehabilitation in dogs. This comprehensive reference offers practical advice and strategies for examining, treating, and managing canine athletes, working dogs, and companion dogs, making it an essential guide for improving patient outcomes.

Key Features

  • Multimodal Approach & Pain Management: New chapters discuss the multimodal approach to managing osteoarthritis, interventional pain management, and the use of assistive devices.
  • Comprehensive Coverage: It explores locomotion and athletic performance, musculoskeletal structure and physiology, the role of nutrition in performance and rehabilitation, and imaging in canine sports medicine.
  • Therapeutic Techniques: Covers manual therapy, physical modalities, therapeutic exercise, aquatic therapy, and conditioning and retraining.
  • Specialized Topics: Includes newly recognized issues specific to working dogs (such as police and assistance dogs) and the current status of the business of sports medicine and rehabilitation.
  • Extensive Visuals: Features more than 500 clinical photographs, radiographs, and line drawings throughout to demonstrate key concepts and procedures.
  • Expert Authorship: Written by 57 leading international experts in the field, including 34 new authors, ensuring the content reflects the latest science and clinical expertise.
  • Broad Audience: An essential reference for veterinarians, physical therapists, veterinary technicians, and anyone interested in working with canine athletes or offering rehabilitation therapy in their practice.

products.title: [October 14, 2025] Canine Sports Medicine and Rehabilitation 3rd Edition
products.body_html:
Canine Sports Medicine and Rehabilitation, 3rd Edition: Your Comprehensive Clinical Reference

Grounded in the latest scientific literature, this book presents the state of the art in sports medicine and rehabilitation in dogs. This comprehensive reference offers practical advice and strategies for examining, treating, and managing canine athletes, working dogs, and companion dogs, making it an essential guide for improving patient outcomes.

Key Features

  • Multimodal Approach & Pain Management: New chapters discuss the multimodal approach to managing osteoarthritis, interventional pain management, and the use of assistive devices.
  • Comprehensive Coverage: It explores locomotion and athletic performance, musculoskeletal structure and physiology, the role of nutrition in performance and rehabilitation, and imaging in canine sports medicine.
  • Therapeutic Techniques: Covers manual therapy, physical modalities, therapeutic exercise, aquatic therapy, and conditioning and retraining.
  • Specialized Topics: Includes newly recognized issues specific to working dogs (such as police and assistance dogs) and the current status of the business of sports medicine and rehabilitation.
  • Extensive Visuals: Features more than 500 clinical photographs, radiographs, and line drawings throughout to demonstrate key concepts and procedures.
  • Expert Authorship: Written by 57 leading international experts in the field, including 34 new authors, ensuring the content reflects the latest science and clinical expertise.
  • Broad Audience: An essential reference for veterinarians, physical therapists, veterinary technicians, and anyone interested in working with canine athletes or offering rehabilitation therapy in their practice.

products.title: [20 October 2025] Virtual Veterinary Care and Telemedicine
products.body_html:
Your Practical Guide to Veterinary Telemedicine

This book is a practical guide to successfully implementing virtual care in veterinary practice, blending historical insights, medical standards, care delivery, business strategy, and team dynamics. Based on real industry experience and featuring case studies throughout, this book is a must-have resource for any veterinarian interested in improving care quality and increasing practice revenues using telemedicine.

Key Features

  • Comprehensive Integration: The book addresses the common challenge of integrating virtual care into hands-on practices and provides a 10-step implementation process and strategies for extending care beyond physical boundaries, ensuring regulatory compliance and continuous quality control.
  • Clinical Protocols: It covers triaging protocols, guidelines for antibiotic use, chronic medication refills, conducting digital and physical exams, optimizing technician appointments, medical record documentation, and maintaining medical quality standards in virtual environments.
  • Business Strategy: The final section addresses the critical aspect of monetization, emphasizing the importance of developing a business model and effective marketing strategies, ensuring growth and enhanced client experiences.
  • Technology Focus: It identifies current features of virtual care software, assisting in tool selection for practices, and discussing future trends.
  • Essential Information: It includes information on the benefits of virtual care, methods for educating clients, and navigating ethical considerations.
  • Broad Audience: A must-have resource for any veterinarian interested in improving care quality and increasing practice revenues using telemedicine.

products.title: Self-Assessment Colour Review of Feline Infectious Diseases 1st Edition
products.body_html:
A Case-Based Guide to Feline Infectious Diseases

This book covers all types of feline infectious diseases, including infections caused by viruses, bacteria, parasites, and fungi. 199 clinical cases are presented randomly, as in practice, and cover the range of infectious diseases that affect all the organ systems of the cat.

Key Features

  • Case-Based Approach: 199 clinical cases are presented randomly, as in practice, to simulate real-life situations.
  • Integrated Learning: The illustrated clinical cases contain integrated questions and detailed explanatory answers, making it a valuable self-assessment tool.
  • Comprehensive Coverage: It covers the range of infectious diseases that affect all the organ systems of the cat.
  • Broad Audience: The book is designed for professionals in practice and in universities, as well as for veterinary students, veterinary nurses, and technicians.

products.title: Equine Internal Medicine: Self-Assessment Color Review Second Edition 2nd Edition
products.body_html:
Your Case-Based Guide to Equine Internal Medicine, 2nd Edition

This book is a valuable resource that presents more than 200 interesting and challenging cases encountered in equine practice. Completely revised and updated, this new edition of a bestseller contains entirely new cases, presented in a random order, just as they would appear in practice.

Key Features

  • Case-Based Approach: The cases are formatted as self-assessment problems comprising integrated questions, illustrations, and detailed explanations designed to educate as well as to provide answers.
  • Comprehensive Coverage: The book covers a wide range of disciplines, including neurology, cardiology, respiratory disease, gastroenterology, urology, infectious diseases, parasitology, hematology, oncology, endocrinology, reproduction, dermatology, ophthalmology, immunology, and musculoskeletal disorders.
  • Broad Audience: Whether preparing for exams or continuing your professional development, this book gives you a firm foundation in how to assess, diagnose, and treat a wide variety of cases.
  • Expert Authorship: Written by well-respected experts from the UK and USA, the book provides a high level of detail and practical information.
  • Detailed Explanations: The authors include pertinent questions with each case to guide you through the case workup and treatments with in-depth answers for each case in the second half of the book.

products.title: Cattle and Sheep Medicine: Self-Assessment Color Review 2nd ed. Edition
products.body_html:
A Case-Based Guide to Cattle and Sheep Medicine, 2nd Edition

This book incorporates over 250 new clinical cases divided equally between cattle and sheep. The cases appear randomly to reflect real-life practice and are presented as a set of integrated questions, photographs, and detailed explanatory answers to educate, not just to test. The book covers important clinical features of a range of common diseases of ruminants encountered in first-opinion practice in a problem-based format.

Key Features

  • Case-Based Format: It includes over 250 new clinical cases that are presented randomly to reflect real-life practice. Each case is presented as a set of integrated questions, photographs, and detailed explanatory answers.
  • Problem-Based Learning: The book covers important clinical features of a range of common diseases of ruminants encountered in first-opinion practice in a problem-based format.
  • Updated Content: The book also contains many diseases not featured in the former edition. While common diseases are also again featured, the situations have been changed to mimic general practice, as a disease does not always manifest with the same clinical features.
  • Practical Treatment: The diagnosis and treatment regimens described are those used by the author over the past 38 years in commercial large animal practice. They acknowledge the time and financial restrictions that occur in many situations but require no specialized facilities or equipment.
  • Revision Tools: New images have been added for all cases, and multiple-choice questions are included for revision purposes.

products.title: Canine Infectious Diseases: Self-Assessment Color Review 1st Edition
products.body_html:
Your Case-Based Guide to Canine Infectious Diseases

This book is the perfect companion to a guide on feline infectious diseases and covers all types of canine infectious diseases, including infections caused by viruses, bacteria, parasites, and fungi. Over 200 clinical cases are presented randomly, as in practice, and cover the range of infectious diseases that affect all the organ systems of the dog.

Key Features

  • Case-Based Approach: Over 200 clinical cases are presented randomly, as in practice, and cover the range of infectious diseases that affect all the organ systems of the dog.
  • International Contributors: The book features international expert contributors, ensuring that the content is authoritative and up-to-date.
  • Integrated Learning: The illustrated cases contain integrated questions and detailed explanatory answers, which makes it a valuable self-assessment tool.
  • Comprehensive Coverage: It covers every type of canine infectious disease, including infections caused by viruses, bacteria, parasites, and fungi.
  • Companion Text: It serves as the perfect companion to a self-assessment color review of feline infectious diseases.

products.title: Avian Medicine and Surgery: Self-Assessment Color Review, 2nd Edition
products.body_html:
Your Quick Reference to Avian Medicine and Surgery, 2nd Edition

This completely revamped second edition of a leading text includes over 260 all-new color illustrated cases, with questions and answers fully exploring a breadth of diseases and disorders. This book provides a unique quick reference for clinicians and a useful self-test for students by offering comprehensive, clinically-oriented information that can be quickly accessed, easily understood, and applied.

Key Features

  • Case-Based Approach: The cases are presented in a random order, just as they would appear in daily practice, challenging the reader to address real clinical situations and offering a comprehensive solution.
  • Comprehensive Coverage: The book covers a wide range of disciplines, organ systems, and species, providing a comprehensive, clinically-oriented approach to avian care.
  • Self-Assessment: The book is a useful self-test for students, with questions and answers that fully explore a breadth of diseases and disorders.
  • Expert Authorship: It includes contributions from leading international authorities with diverse fields of expertise, ensuring the content is authoritative and up-to-date.

  • Broad Audience: A unique quick reference for clinicians and a useful self-test for students, this book is designed to support a wide range of veterinary professionals.
  • Visual Learning: The book includes over 260 all-new color illustrated cases, with questions and answers that fully explore a breadth of diseases and disorders.

products.title: Comparative Pathology and Immunohistochemistry of Veterinary Species – June 30, 2023
products.body_html:
A Guide to Comparative Pathology and Immunohistochemistry

This book is a compilation of high-quality papers on comparative pathology and immunohistochemistry of veterinary species. The content focuses on fundamental and applied research, with the ultimate goal of advancing our medical knowledge of both human and veterinary species.

Key Features

  • In-Depth Research: The book includes 11 high-quality papers addressing different areas of pathology.
  • Comparative Pathology: The content focuses on comparative pathology, which is crucial for our understanding of infectious diseases, particularly those with a zoonotic component.
  • Immunohistochemistry: The book covers immunohistochemistry, a key area of research in this field.
  • International Expertise: A total of 62 authors from seven countries have contributed to this book, providing a broad international perspective.
  • Research and Clinical Relevance: This reprint focuses on fundamental and applied research, making it a valuable resource for both researchers and clinicians.
